review: And that‚Äôs not saying much. However, I do enjoy Bumble. Its easy to use and it offers speed dating every Thursday. however, I wish some of the features were more personalized or offered as add-ins. For example I would like the option to pay for bee-line (allows you to see who likes your profile) without having to pay for a full subscription like premium or boost. Other than that, the app itself is fine. The biggest problems you ladies (straight cis-gender) will run into isn‚Äôt really the app‚Äôs fault. After you match with someone, you‚Äôre given 24hrs to message them and they only have 24hrs to respond. A lot of times, guys don‚Äôt respond at all. You‚Äôll also run into men who are just looking for hookups, which is typical. The other issue is the never ending one-sided small talk. A lot of these guys can‚Äôt hold a conversation or they expect you to do all of the work because bumble requires women to initiate the conversation. If your goal is to land a date in person, it‚Äôs going to take some patience, unless of course you‚Äôre a super model or something. Overall, its always ideal to meet ppl in person, but I think Bumble is a safe platform to explore your options. Use this as a supplement for your dating routine. Don‚Äôt solely rely on Bumble

review: This app is good for meeting new people, however, it‚Äôs kinda unfair to use. What I mean by this is that if you end up liking someone or someone (or that person) likes you, in order for you to see who that is or for it to be an official match, you must pay $18 just to see who they are that liked you, which is really unnecessary and expensive if all you‚Äôre trying to do is meet someone, and god forbid it‚Äôs someone you don‚Äôt find interesting or doesn‚Äôt match your personality, then you‚Äôd end up just blowing $18 for no reason when the whole point was just to meet someone YOU thought was perfect for you. And on top of that, the women have to make the first move (which isn‚Äôt necessarily a bad thing), but some don‚Äôt make a move at all after matching (from what I experienced). So it then makes it unclear as to whether they even meant to do that in the first place or not, and since I (a male) can‚Äôt say anything first, I‚Äôm just left in the dark as to why I haven‚Äôt heard from anyone cause I can‚Äôt say anything to confirm if she‚Äôs willing to meet. Im not trying to complain or say it‚Äôs a bad app or anything cause it actually does what it‚Äôs supposed to do, but I‚Äôm just pointing out the flaws of paying an expensive price just to see who swiped you and whether it was worth the money or not and also pointing out the communication issues between people.
title: Not bad, but needs work

review: I have been a Bumble user for quite sometime now. When I opened a second case, although I shouldn‚Äôt have had to in the first place, I received a general response with absolutely no details or personal reflection of my inquiry simply telling me I can purchase the additional subscription for the additional cost, which wasn‚Äôt even what I was inquiring about in the first place. You‚Äôd think for a site that prides itself on its users and highlights a CEO who makes billions of the site, the customer service would be somewhat adequate to answer the concerns of the users in a timely manner. However that is far from the reality of this app and it‚Äôs customer service. Would highly recommend staying away from this app and using one of the competitors, they are better sites anyway. I hope one of the employees reaches out to me in regards to this review, but all we know that will never actually happen. My subscription will be my last and I have already cancelled any further charges associated with this app. Would recommend anyone else who uses it to do the same.

review:
bumble was my last shot at finding someone who was looking for the same kind of relationship as me. I was looking for something long term, and none of the other apps I tried seemed to have an option for that. With bumble, not only was this an option, but I found my perfect match. Every day I‚Äôm grateful that bumble exists for this reason. I do not have the app anymore for obvious reasons, but I recommend it highly to anyone who is looking to find a real, loving and healthy relationship. Most dating apps are set up for hookups and such. With bumble this is not the case if you don‚Äôt want it to be. I love the idea of the girl talking first too. As a girl, this does make things a little awkward, but it helps to be the one making the first move. As in other dating apps, guys typically hit girls with pickup lines or flat out ask if they want to hook up. I felt like I could explain what I was looking for so much easier with bumble. My personal trainer had recommended it to me after he found his now wife on the app. I‚Äôm so glad he told me about it. Me and my boyfriend have been together for 8 months now, and are planning on a long happy future together. 

Thank you bumble, from the bottom of my heartüíõ
title: thank you bumbleüíõ

developerResponse: {'id': 38821993, 'body': "We're sorry to hear about this. Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport), so our team can take a look.", 'modified': '2023-09-10T04:31:39Z'}
review: Despite official answers to the contrary, Bumble absolutely does "shadow ban."  By not banning outright, this allows them to take your money and not be held accountable.  Tinder has done this for a long time, and I suspect there is not only a back-channel sharing a blacklist amongst all Match-owned sites but also industry-wide.  Reports against your profile (credible or not) are never properly investigated; anything at all will do as long as you are male, especially white, to justify adding you to a list to ensure your profile will never get shown to others.  They track everything... email, phone, billing information, wireless networks, photo hashes.  And now they use AI to retarget in case you use different photos or alter another to change the hash.  The point is, once you are on this list, even if you change phones, emails addresses, short of plastic surgery, you will continue to be shadow banned across all platforms.  Conspiracy?  Yes.  Fraudulent due to them continuing to take money with the customer expectation they will receive the same service ad everyone else?  Absolutely.  One day all of this will be exposed, but it won't happen any time soon.  Save your money and find some other means to make connections.  You will not find them on this app and especially any Match-owned one.  The blacklist is real.  Shadow banning is real, and Bumble's continued lie that it does not practice it becomes laughable once one starts using the app.
title: Fraudulent Company and App

developerResponse: {'id': 35915124, 'body': "Hi there. This doesn‚Äôt sound ideal and we'd love to investigate what's happening on your account. Can you please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. We're sure we‚Äôll have you up and buzzin' again in no time!", 'modified': '2023-04-12T13:19:03Z'}
review: I have been using Bumble for YEARS and have never had any issues with the app itself. I am mid conversation with someone I am finally hitting it off with, and I go to open the app AFTER IT NOTIFIES ME THAT HE REPLIED, to find the screen that wants you to make an account. No big deal. Maybe a glitch. So I try to long back in using Apple and it is asking me to create a new account, implying the one I was using just moment before no longer exists. So I try to log in via phone number to find out I have been banned for "either buying or selling." Even after reading the User Agreement I have no idea what that means, all I know is that I've never tried to buy or sell a single thing in the, again, years, that I've been on this app. So I googled it to see what the issue was and everything I read stated there would be an email or some kind of warning that my account was being deleted/banned. I got neither. I very much understand and appreciate the safety measures put in place to ensure we're all in good hands using dating platforms like this, but I personally think that this was ridiculous. Now, not only do I not get to move forward with someone I was hitting it off with 2 seconds before I no longer had an account, but I was also PAYING A SUBSCRIPTION that I won't be getting my money back for. And this isn't even something I can appeal. What a disappointment and what turns out to be a waste of my money over the years.
title: A Joke

review:
I don‚Äôt know what it is about Bumble- if it‚Äôs the fact that women start the conversation, causing them to use it less, or a lack of use relative to other dating apps, or the algorithm for non-paying users- but in the month I have had it I haven‚Äôt had a single match. And I‚Äôm not saying this as a bummed out nerd who is taking their lack of female attention out on the app itself; I use just about every other dating platform and get consistent likes/matches. It makes me think that users who don‚Äôt pay suffer when it comes to views, but I‚Äôm not willing to pay the INSANE amount of money they are asking to test that theory. 
They could easily offer a lower tier of premium with the use of ad revenue, rather than banking that users will pay the exorbitant amount of money required to get your profile out there - and that goes for all dating apps. 
This no doubt causes users to lose faith in the app, or the process in general, and it‚Äôs not a sustainable business model. 
It‚Äôs a bummer, too, I honestly like the idea of women starting the conversation and I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs a welcome breath of fresh air for them, not constantly being bombarded by creepy dudes all day long. I also like the profile structure (apart from the MEGA cheesy prompt selection). Maybe one day I‚Äôll try paying for a month to see if that makes a difference, but for the time being, Hinge and Tinder seem to be working ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

review: I‚Äôm from another country and Arrived here still in the middle of the pandemic, so was very difficult to make friends, even with my type of work I didn‚Äôt have the chance to meet a lot of people so when covid restrictions were more relax this app was a good option to meet new people. After a break of man and take a time for me,  I was ready to see what was there, without any big expectations‚Ä¶ but the destiny made me met who is my boyfriend right now. review: Bumble unprofessionally and un-provokingly blocked and banned my account. review: If I could give this 0 stars (or less) I would! It looks great on paper, until you have a problem. I had been having problems with the amount of likes I was getting from the free membership. I was getting about 10-20 likes every week or more. I went 2 months one time checking every week and didn‚Äôt have liked for that whole time. I put in a ticket to ask how many likes I should have and explained the situation. They responded saying I should have 30 likes per 24 hours and that I‚Äôve used mine for today (it had been a week since I had any likes). I then tried to explain again and was ghosted. For a couple weeks I was trying to get in touch with them about my ticket with no response. I then opened another ticket to ask for help again. They didn‚Äôt even acknowledge this one. Today (about 2 months later) I got an email saying they hadn‚Äôt heard from me so they were closing me ticket‚Ä¶ I responded saying that they should have heard from me in this ticket AND another one. I had deleted my app at this point due to the frustration and sour taste left because of support. They then sent an automatic response email, which made it even more obvious they never read my email today OR any of the emails before. The two emails I have from them were the same exact automatic response emails and it didn‚Äôt answer either of my emails in any sort of way.

While we continue to work hard to improve this, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-12-08T08:51:27Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been on and off Bumble for a few years now and it has really gone downhill over the years. First things first, Premium has gone up in price. I remember premium was like $20 a month or so, then it went to $30, $35, to now $50!!! It is way too overpriced and not really that beneficial, why would I want to pay $50 just to see who likes me only for them to to not talk to me, or they‚Äôre 50 miles away when I have my preference to 20 miles!! Also they say that premium profiles get shown more but I highly doubt it because I‚Äôm usually on the app everyday swiping, and have maybe only gotten one like within the span of about every two weeks!! Premium is not worth the $50, especially since it seems like a lot of women are only using the app to promote their Instagram/Onlyfans. I don‚Äôt think this is Bumble‚Äôs fault at all, but I can‚Äôt justify spending $50 just be targeted by someone who‚Äôs not looking for a relationship, and only looking for my credit card number. I think this is my last time using Bumble. It stinks because I have been successful in the past with matches and going on dates, but it seems that this app is just getting greedy and getting ruined by opportunists. If you want to go on dates and actually find something meaningful, go on Hinge or Coffee Meets Bagel, I‚Äôve had better luck recently on those apps. Or, if you want to skip the hassle, just pay for eHarmony/Match.
title: Gone Downhill Over the Years

developerResponse: {'id': 23558123, 'body': "Thanks for letting us know of your experience, Sebastian. It sounds like things aren't quite working as they should be and we'd love to take a closer look at your profile and see what's going on. Do you mind sending us a message at http://bumble.com/contact?", 'modified': '2021-06-24T06:37:29Z'}
review: Not a bad app. Haven‚Äôt gotten any targeted ads yet, and haven‚Äôt been smothered with obvious fakes either. I‚Äôm giving the lower rating because they have basically put the ‚ÄúDealbreaker‚Äù buttons in your range settings as a placebo. I‚Äôve been trying to go mile-by-mile outward, because there is an entire college just outside of 40 miles away, and my queue will be entirely dominated by people from that college if I don‚Äôt restrict my range. What I find happening anyway is I will still see people OUTSIDE that range after I‚Äôve set my range to be a dealbreaker! Even sneakier, I will sometimes find that this setting has been turned off for me, as if they‚Äôre trying to pull a fast one on me. In addition, how is it that one day I can swipe through every profile in a specific range, but the next day there‚Äôs several less than 10 miles out? Not likely they made their profile day, since that little ‚Äúnew here‚Äù bubble appears on their profile. There is clearly some sneaky business going on to restrict your swiping to people who will never see your profile past a certain point, and hold some in reserve so you can swipe on for longer. In the end, however, these practices are less predatory than most of your other options for dating apps. If you‚Äôre dead set on picking on, this is probably your best bet.
title: Deceptive with your matching preferences.

developerResponse: {'id': 35602220, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2023-03-27T07:42:09Z'}
review:
I will say that Bumble is leagues above other dating apps like Tinder. A major issue that I have is that men can‚Äôt filter by weight. I don‚Äôt find myself personally attracted to heavier-set women because it‚Äôs often times a visualization of the lower standards they have for themselves. Also, I think the majority of healthy men are unattracted to overweight women just like how the majority of women are unattracted to short men. I seem to live in an area where there is a fairly high proportion of overweight women and I waste so much time having to swipe through large volumes of them.

What is unfair about this is that women have the ability to filter based on height. Now I‚Äôve been blessed with being 6‚Äô3 but I understand from friends how difficult it can be to generate interest from women if they‚Äôre short. That being said, I totally understand and believe that the women on this app should be able to filter on height. The thing that I find puzzling is that height is a trait that cannot be fixed but weight is! So why can‚Äôt I filter out women who don‚Äôt put themselves through high health standards like I do? I understand that weight differs based on height, age, and muscle mass so I think having an ability to calculate BMI through the app and then being able to filter by that would be a good method.

Men can and should have standards too!
title: Men can‚Äôt filter by weight but women can filter by height

developerResponse: {'id': 28986426, 'body': 'We‚Äôre really glad you spoke up about this. We deeply value inclusion and want everyone to feel welcome and supported at all times. Your voice has been heard and while we continue to work hard to improve this, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ', 'modified': '2022-04-05T20:49:37Z'}
review: This app is overall okay. I like that they have a lot of options on things you can add to your profile, but their monthly price is really high. $40 for basically one month, and $20 for a week, just so you can see people who have swiped on you or even to just filter things such as height preference. But what really gets me here, is the way they handle gender identity and how they categorize it. I‚Äôm a trans male, who‚Äôs interested in women, and I‚Äôve had no problems in my past with dating women. But if I change my gender identity to ‚Äútrans man‚Äù on this app and set my preference as ‚Äúwomen‚Äù my feed is changed to nothing but other women who are interested in women, or people looking for ‚Äúpoly‚Äù relationships. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm quite what lesbians are looking for bumble? But once I set my gender back to ‚Äúmale‚Äù I‚Äôm brought back to women who are interested in men. So I have no choice but to just put ‚Äúmale‚Äù and then that I‚Äôm ‚Äútrans‚Äù in my bio. So maybe something needs to be changed about that? Why should I feel that I‚Äôm less of a man on this app? I get that you try and pair ‚Äúlgbtq+‚Äù with others in that same category, but make it make sense. If I say I‚Äôm ‚Äústraight‚Äù I should only be seeing what my preference is. If others choose to not like me because I‚Äôm trans, let them make that decision.
title: Gender settings are nice, but a bit weird.

It‚Äôs not difficult to see who likes your profile since bumble‚Äôs blurred image for your queue is easily distinguishable when swiping. HOWEVER, these profiles still showed up in the stack and they are unable to unlike your profile once they‚Äôve swiped right. review: I think all dating apps has its pros and cons but what Bumble lacks is putting it behind apps like Tinder (I hate to even compare it to Tinder) and Hinge. For example, Tinder at least has the feature where you can search numbers through your contact list and block them from seeing your profile in the app. I wish Bumble had a similar feature because you do see a lot of the same user profiles in most of the dating apps and I‚Äôd like to be able to block someone that I didn‚Äôt necessarily connect well with or from having a family member or coworker see my profile. Also the 24 hour match feature where the woman has to message the guy first and wait for him to respond during that time or else the match completely disappear is just not right. I sometimes go days without checking the app because I‚Äôm busy with work and life in general or choose to take mental breaks, before logging back on and then finding my ‚Äúmatch‚Äù has disappeared. I‚Äôve lost many potential matches this way or some that I‚Äôve messaged and they don‚Äôt respond with the 24 hours. At least give the woman (who has to message the match‚Äù an option to extend that message time so that maybe when the guy logs back on, he has a chance to see the actual message.

title: Can‚Äôt find my home town

review: I like the interface and the chat options. That's about it. I use the service because everyone else is here. What I dislike the most is how the chat history disappears when the connection is unmatched. If someone actually wanted to be an adult and end the convo maturely it'll all be for nothing because the other person will never see the last message. Bumble makes everyone ghosters. What if someone wanted to say, "hey I'm getting off here text me at ......" then unmatches everyone cause they don't know what happens on the other end... we'd never know! Second, also in the realm of ghosting, I dislike the 24 hour response window. I'm trying to match with quality men and I don't expect any to log in and respond everyday on a dating app. That means the most valuable matches are risked being lost; forever. These things make the experience very disappointing. Then there are other nuances like auto sending a gif. Or not being able to swipe back to the chat list (instead it initiated the reply function, so annoying). And alerting the other party of you playing the question game... Real smooth Bumble. Please get rid of the timer and deleting the full chat history. If anything change to a fun response if someone responds in the first 24 hours and only removing the chat typing box after an unmatch.
title: High volume, low fun

review: I use a few dating apps (Tinder + Hinge as well), and at first I felt like Bumble was the best because I had the option to send a message first, which I liked! I‚Äôm not sure what it is about this app but most of my matches have all had stalker-like tendencies and when I actually met up with one of them in person (because the others were very obvious red flags concerning SAFETY that I wasn‚Äôt willing to try), I felt completely unsafe because they had continued to stalk me, create new profiles and try to catfish me, followed me under different instagram accounts etc until I finally decided to change my phone number. I did report one instance to Bumble and was not notified on how it was handled. Mind you, went out with this guy ONCE. I‚Äôm still afraid to this day that he is following me somehow. I‚Äôve had A LOT better luck with Hinge specifically, their team is super responsive QUICK and take reports seriously, which makes me feel good! Hinge has been fun and I‚Äôve met great people there! Not sure if it‚Äôs because Bumble requires the woman to make the first move‚Ä¶? I think the waiting game culminates into an obsessive kind of behavior, personally. title: Feels unsafe

One thing that discourages me is that there can be so many attractive people in your area but not only is it possible to not have likes, but just to get noticed I feel like you have to buy spotlight. I definitely feel like it‚Äôs way easier for women to get matches compared to men, but I may also be wrong. Unless you are an EXPERT with patience, and you only have an interaction here and there, I think it‚Äôs best to meet people in person. I know we live in a digital world, but still don‚Äôt believe dating apps are for everyone. My advice, try the app. If it bears good fruit, God bless. If it doesn‚Äôt, stay away.

review:
This event happened over a year ago and I‚Äôve yet to receive any response or for of communication from anyone from the Bumble team. 

I matched with this girl and from the beginning I should‚Äôve seen the red flags. We met up to hang out then insisted I go back to her place. I was hesitant to do it but I wasn‚Äôt expecting anything bad to happen. After a few drinks we were sitting on the couch and she started touching me. I wasn‚Äôt comfortable with the way this was happening so I told her to stop. Needless to say she didn‚Äôt. She just kept touching me. I must‚Äôve offended her because she insulted me and said I must not like girls if I didn‚Äôt consent, then proceeded to grab me. I‚Äôm a large man so I was able to get her away and left. I went to report her in the app but it seems she had gotten to me first. I couldn‚Äôt even go to the police if I wanted to because I had no way of getting her name or info because bumble banned my profile and any new ones I try to create. I‚Äôve sent countless emails to them hoping to get unbanned or at least the information from the girl. I even attached as much evidence as I could to support my claims, but haven‚Äôt hear a single word. All I want is to make sure this doesn‚Äôt happen to other men or people in general. Seems like the team at bumble isn‚Äôt very worried about the safety of their users. At this point I don‚Äôt want to make another profile I just want help.
title: Help

developerResponse: {'id': 34805283, 'body': "Hi there. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. While we continue to work hard to improve this, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2023-02-11T04:51:21Z'}
review:
Who likes dating apps? Not me, because it feels like I‚Äôm shopping for a person and putting myself on a market (which is really what dating apps are for, obviously). 

However, with the free version, you can send messages to matches (they have 24 hours to respond) and you have unlimited messages once you match. In addition, Bumble adapts. I actually like that they changed it to only allowing you to view/like a few people at a time ‚Äî it helps keep you logging in, so you maybe won‚Äôt miss messages with/from matches. A downside to this change, though, is that I always have, like, 50 likes (most of them I won‚Äôt like back because we‚Äôre clearly incompatible in some way), and it‚Äôs going to take longer to make matches with those likes. But, anything good takes time‚Ä¶ so, I guess that makes sense. 

Bumble is doing alright ‚Äî with BFF (helpful when you‚Äôve moved to a new state!) and with Date. If I‚Äôm going to pay for a dating app, I wouldn‚Äôt mind paying them to upgrade (versus others so far tried that like to limit everything you do until you pay for it, and limit to extreme lengths). If a free version says a lot about an app (which is generally true), the free version of this one is effective and user-friendly.
title: User-friendly and safe

developerResponse: {'id': 38080060, 'body': "It sounds like your admirers don't fit the Advanced Filters you have set. Try removing all of your filters; these users should show up then. If not, or if you still have questions, feel free to reach out to us on Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport). We're here for you and always happy to help!", 'modified': '2023-08-03T15:02:35Z'}
review:
Bumble thrives on the loneliness of people and if they genuinely cared about match making and did so properly, they‚Äôd eventually not have as many paying users. Therefore, it‚Äôs in their best interest to actually stifle your success at finding someone. With that said, they have a plethora of paid tiers all aimed at getting you SLIGHTLY closer at meeting someone, but there‚Äôs also some other service you gotta buy: boosting your profile, unlimited swipes, leaving complements, etc.

One night I wanna a bet with a friend and had some extra cash and decided to give bumble premium a try. I thought that with the ability to swipe unlimited, for SURE I‚Äôd make a good number of connections‚ÄîWRONG. At one point it got so ridiculous, I stopped reading profiles and just mindlessly swiped just to test my theory that their algorithms were actually geared towards preventing me matching with people. Unsurprisingly, even after quite possibly HUNDREDS of swipes, I got maybe 2 matched, no lie. Either I‚Äôm that ugly of a dude (which I don‚Äôt think so since I match reasonably well on other apps) or they‚Äôre putting me in some kind of queue that, unless you pay for their ‚Äúboosting‚Äù service, you won‚Äôt be seen ever. 

Don‚Äôt buy premium, in fact don‚Äôt pay for anything on this app, it‚Äôll be a waste of your money. I won‚Äôt be buying premium again, stupidest waste of money.
title: Bumble is like the cancer industry

review: This is a terrible app . I only had it for 1 day and they blocked me immediately for no reason. The reason it was it because they said I was doing inappropriate selling which is not true. I barely even had the app for a full day before they block me. I emailed them to try to get in contact with  support so they can try to verify that wasn‚Äôt true . I asked them to show proof of that  or if they can actually verify the information that they received and they didn‚Äôt have any verification of that . They still wouldn‚Äôt allow me to get the account back and they sent mea email  saying  they would no longer respond to any further emails .I honestly wanna sue this app because the fact  that you guys blocked me for a reason that‚Äôs not true and I only had that count for less than a full day doesn‚Äôt make sense. And then you they  don‚Äôt know how to properly communicate. if anybody wants to good app to use go on tinder I had the app for seven years never any problems. title: Terrible I got blocked on the first day wasn‚Äôt even a full 24 hours

review: This app USED to be great! As a woman, when this was introduced to me 4 years ago, I was impressed by its motto. We talk first. I found it was an easy and understandable outlet to meet people you never expect. But Bumble‚Äôs developers have taken something great and twisted it around for money. We used to be able to set two advanced preferences and now you‚Äôve stripped that privilege. Unless we give you Penny pinchers money. It‚Äôs not even about ‚Äúnot giving someone a chance‚Äù. We are humans! There are things we like and don‚Äôt like, is that so wrong? It‚Äôs much easier to limit the insane pool of people in one area then tirelessly swipe through people you know you in reality you probably won‚Äôt even go out with. And just when I thought it couldn‚Äôt get any worse‚Ä¶there‚Äôs a SWIPE LIMIT??? What??? When did this get put in place? It is so ridiculously pointless and glitchy. And leaves you wasting so much time swiping through people you aren‚Äôt interested in. Every person is not going to be a match. So what are you trying to force here? You‚Äôre giving so many people false hope by making the pool so wide. We live in such a judgmental society that there will be tones of people swiping and nothing will happen. I am so disappointed in the developments on this app. It honestly makes hinge look like a gold star now. And I used to think quite the opposite.
title: A Penny Pinchers Development

We know you've got this! üíõ", 'modified': '2023-02-16T08:52:03Z'}
review: I have checked out quite a few dating apps lately and this one is at the bottom of my list, not that any of them are fantastic. Sadly, I wasn‚Äôt aware when I paid for the subscription that messages disappear after 24 hours (and that BEFORE you send the message you can extend that time, bit not after). Anyway, my day 1 & I responded to a few interests (the night before the Super Bowl no less) that had actually ‚Äúliked‚Äù me first, didn‚Äôt reply in 24 hours & were gone. Even though customer service said they would reappear in my search, that is not true. According to my app, there are no more (huh? Lol) people in my criteria, I never did see the few I messaged again & I was left with a bunch of others that are not ‚Äúmy type‚Äù even though the app says it knows my type. Lol. It also does not show people you swiped off a second time. So make sure when you swipe them off you never want to reconsider them because you won‚Äôt ever see them again. Also, make  sure before you pay for this and send your first messages you read all the rules and other things so you don‚Äôt potentially lose out like I did. Really disappointed because I thought this would be my favorite out of the apps and turned out to the the most disappointing. Waste of money, honestly.
title: Mediocre

review:
I got premium for a week to see if I would get better results and to be able to bring back the people that I timed out with. While I had premium, I got no swipes. I thought no one liked me, which is fair. But as soon as I ended my premium, a bunch of people swiped on me. Not only that, but I‚Äôve been spamming swipe right to try and match with them, but not a single one has matched üòê I‚Äôve swiped so much that I continue to use up all my swipes for the day. Bottom line, don‚Äôt get premium. It‚Äôs a waste of money and bumble is just trying to scam you.

They said it‚Äôs cause of advanced filters, but I swiped so much when I had filters on, that it started expanding out side of my filters (mind you, I had filters even before I had premium, so nothing changed) and that still doesn‚Äôt change the fact that with every swipe I get (and I swipe right on literally everyone because I‚Äôm desperate to make friends) none of them end up being the people that matched with me. For ideas to improve your profile check out these resources (1) bumble.com/the-buzz/best-bumble-profile-photo-tips and (2) bumble.com/help/i-m-not-getting-any-matches. We‚Äôd love to address all of your concerns, please message us at @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook. Alternatively, you can contact us via bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2023-08-11T08:05:22Z'}
review:
I started using this app right around 2016 and had a decent amount of luck on it. I think back then there was a limit of 100 swipes per day or more. What I understand is that while the free version needs to limit the swipes to monetize, the experience as a straight male suffers as a result. 

It‚Äôs not that I think the limit on males is really a problem, but it‚Äôs the limit for women that makes the experience worse. Let‚Äôs say I pay for premium (I once considered lifetime which I‚Äôm not sure is an option anymore?). Sure, I‚Äôd get unlimited swipes, but any women using the free version still get 25/day, so this will make the smaller population pickier which just hurts everyone. 

Idk for sure, but I‚Äôm willing to bet the population that pays most are straight men. Maybe consider increasing the free limit for just women to 50+/day? The way I see it, it would create a ripple, men have more potential matches, more incentive to subscribe, and women feel less concerned to only pick 25 per day. From my perspective, I‚Äôm never going to subscribe if 2/350 match when it used to be 5/100 or so. Why would I pay to swipe through 100 people a day if it means less than 1 per day match and 1/500 start the conversation?
title: Used to be Better - New limits kinda killed it

developerResponse: {'id': 34805760, 'body': "Hi there. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. While we continue to work hard to improve this, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2023-02-11T06:41:02Z'}
review: Through my 2 year experience with the app, I‚Äôd like to give me truthfully and honest opinion about the app. First off I give it a 3 star because this app doesn‚Äôt care about weather or not you find someone. At one point it did but now it‚Äôs turned into a ‚Äúpay to play‚Äù app, which is unfortunate considering how much bumble pushes and promotes finding ‚Äúthe one‚Äù through them. Number 2 bumble has a simple algorithm: we give you a limited amount of swipes, we‚Äôll have 2 ‚Äúmock‚Äù profiles shoot you likes but you won‚Äôt get to see them nor be able to like them back. Oh no you ran out of swipes? Well simple pay us for premium and you‚Äôll get all the benefits except the two profiles that liked you won‚Äôt text you within the 24 hour period we give them to text you. Now for the rest of the time you have premium you‚Äôll have all the benefits but won‚Äôt reap the reward of finding someone. Very simple algorithm to understand and it amazes me how the app will consistently continue to make you believe that you‚Äôll eventually find a match. So inclusion if you are going to spend money on a dating app, go to Tinder; because at least there, they won‚Äôt  sell you a bunch of lies to keep you on there.
title: Honest Review About Bumble

developerResponse: {'id': 38701315, 'body': "We're sorry to hear about this. Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport), so our team can take a look.", 'modified': '2023-09-04T08:12:56Z'}
review:
I used Bumble for a long time, never had any problems. As far as I know, I followed all the rules. Out of the blue I got banned with no warning or explanation or anyway to get any recourse. That was after I paid for the premium service and I got no refund. Avoid this app. They ban people for no reason, or likely based on the lies of people you reject. Don‚Äôt waste your money. I tried emailing them several times for an explanation and got nothing. Terrible customer service. Their terms of service say that you are not entitled to a refund if you break their rules. I did not break any of their rules and yet I was canceled without a refund. 
Until they can figure out how to circumvent bans based on revenge reports, or false reports I would advise everyone to avoid this app. 
They say that they don‚Äôt ban people arbitrarily, but based on my experience and what I‚Äôve read from other people, they ban people over flimsy or even fabricated reports. Anyone can literally submit a report accusing someone of bad offline behavior. Bumble makes no effort to verify or follow up, they just ban. It‚Äôs a joke.
The policy should be that if you get banned without a warning then you get your money back. Otherwise it‚Äôs just a scam; they take your money but can decide to deny you their service without a refund for any reason they decide. Thats practically fraud.
title: Banned for no reason

review: I downloaded this app after I had a falling out with my friend group. I was in a bad spot, desperately in need of some people in my life that I could trust and have a good time with. I downloaded bumble and used the BFF feature, but I didn‚Äôt really think anything would come of it. But after quite a few dead end conversations, I matched with a girl and we really hit it off. She introduced me to some of her friends, many of who she had met on bumble too. We all quickly became close friends, seeing each other 2-3x a week. Since then, I have met 4 or 5 other people on the app that I have introduced to my newfound friend group, and our group continues to expand with new people that we meet on bumble. I now have more amazing, trustworthy, GREAT friends than I had ever had in the past. These friends will all be my lifelong friends. Relationships are such an important part of my life, and I truly have never been so happy. If you are considering downloading bumble to use the BFF feature, don‚Äôt hesitate, just do it. You never know, it could change your life. Thank you bumble.
title: Bumble BFF is life changing

Whilst this is the way our app works now, we'll be sure to pass your feedback onto our Product Team. If you have any other suggestions feel free to contact our team at bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2022-10-17T13:54:22Z'}
review:
Having used this app on and off with no success so far, it seems populated with roughly the same kind of people you would expect on Tinder, though the app is made to provide more detail and help ensure you find someone with the right personality, like I tend to want to instead of simply engaging in hookups. However, the dual features of matches expiring after 24 hours and only women being able to respond first to curb harassment makes it rather difficult for people like me, the good-intentioned though usually overlooked users, to be easily ignored. I have actually seen less engaging matches on here compared to any other site, even Tinder, and those matches usually have me requiring to respond first to start anything. It‚Äôs a shame because the app is structured well and provides great features, but it fails to let anything flourish for someone that normally does not make first approaches out of fear of rejection but does so on these apps. It can make using the app feel worse than simply doing nothing, something I have experienced multiple times.

Also, I have been both a free and paid user with the same outcome of nothing when using this app as either status.
title: Understandable Intent, Unfortunate Results

review:
I used bumble a while back and I found it was very easy to use and helped me find a few dates. I recently decided to give it another go, but in order to actually see any of the people who like you you have to pay a $21 subscription fee. What‚Äôs the point? Look, I‚Äôm completely understanding that companies are looking to make money off of apps, but most of them allow you to use basic features for free, or at the very last show ads. That‚Äôs not even the case at all here. They let you waste time building a profile, adding pictures, seeing if there‚Äôs anyone you want to match with, then God forbid anyone likes you back and you want to see them, you have to subscribe. Also $21 is steep. Most streaming services don‚Äôt cost half of that price and it just seems insane to me. I will uninstall and never use again when there‚Äôs plenty of other working options for this type of thing out there that let you use their service without requiring paying monthly. Also, it‚Äôs $21 a WEEK, $45 a month.

Also can you cut the crap with the adding pronouns section? If somebody cares so much about letting you know, they can easily put it in their bio. Thanks for the heads up. God forbid I found a solid match and they didn‚Äôt have the pronouns I was interested in, I‚Äôd have to swipe left.
title: Subscription has ruined this app

developerResponse: {'id': 39216506, 'body': 'We‚Äôre thrilled you made such a special connection in the Hive! Please tell us more about your story at https://bumble.com/success-stories/share üíõ', 'modified': '2023-09-29T11:37:25Z'}
review:
Little bit of a long story so here goes!
I downloaded Bumble in September of 2019 and I had tried Tinder and other routes of dating and nothing seemed to be working. A friend of mine recommended I try Bumble and after a couple days I was at work scrolling through and I come across this beautiful lady. Very sincere in every word, felt like I got a strong understanding of who she was on the profile descriptions she had. I swipe right on her and think ‚Äúno way she matches with me but hey worth a shot‚Äù next thing I know it was an instant match! I was excited but not getting my hopes up, it‚Äôs internet dating this doesn‚Äôt go very far most of the time. 

She texts me a couple a hours later and we start talking about music, both of our lives and what we do for work, shortly later we FaceTime and we talk consistently for a month before finally meeting in person. We started dating in October, 2019, got engaged October of 2021 and just got married in September of 2023! If it wasn‚Äôt for Bumble I would‚Äôve never met my wife and I don‚Äôt know where I‚Äôd be in my life.
title: Found true love through Bumble!

developerResponse: {'id': 26624139, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2021-12-03T11:11:12Z'}
review:
So I accidentally purchased a Premium plan a while back, whatever, my fault.  Happened to get off all dating app platforms shortly afterwards until just recently, and trying to get my purchase restored to my new account has been a nightmare.

First off, I‚Äôm fairly certain Bumble is the sole app that lacks an in-app purchase restoration option, which feels pretty shady.  As far as I can tell, they also lack a customer service chat AND phone number, leaving e-mail as the only available method.  Initially, I was told they couldn‚Äôt find my purchase receipt.  Then, after explaining that I was not the primary account holder in my Family Plan and perhaps it was tied to that email ‚Äî though it shouldn‚Äôt be, as it was made my from previous Bumble account tied to my Apple ID ‚Äî they stated they had in fact already found it, but they would instead need the payment confirmation from my email.  Ended up providing it in a response, then tried following up and even sent a whole new inquiry, and still have yet to hear anything from them after several hours.

I have to ask, is this an intentional run-around to withhold services despite payment?  Perhaps even aiming at further purchases made out of exasperation?
title: Pretty Horrendous Customer Service

review: Listen, I was pretty reluctant to go on a dating website because I honestly thought that I wasn't going to find anything. For the first couple of months I found people to talk to here and there and even went on a couple of dates with them but nothing ever stuck unfortunately. On February 1st, I really had enough and thought that it was pointless so I decided to give bumble a couple more days and then I was going to delete it. On February 3rd I matched with a boy named Cam. We talked for awhile on the app and finally decided to meet in real life since he only lived 30 minutes away from me. That one date led to another and another and then another after that. We have been together for almost 3 months now which doesn't sound like a lot of time but those 3 months have been the best months of my entire life. We are so in love with eachother and if it weren't for bumble we never would've met. So shoutout to bumble for matching me with the man of my dreams that I plan on spending the rest of my life with. And to those who are reading this... DON'T GIVE UP HOPE!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 27609952, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2022-01-23T19:31:03Z'}
review: I used to enjoy using Bumble (as much as one can enjoy dating apps), but I refused to spend the amount required for the premium/boosted memberships. With the free version, I could swipe to my heart's content and take advantage of the two free advanced filters. This was especially important to me because I am looking for someone who wants to be in a relationship and matches my political beliefs. However, with the recent update, all the enjoyable features have been blocked by the paywall now. I didn't mind the ads or the fact that I couldn't see who liked me. But now, I cannot use my advanced filters. Worst of all, I can only swipe on a limited amount of people on the app (if you use up all your "swipes" in date mode, it affects BFF mode too). Now I'm prompted to wait until tomorrow to even look at ("connect with") more people. This service is slowly turning into other dating services that I refuse to use because they are pointless unless you pay for membership. Part of Bumble's mission statement claims that it wants to create empowering connection in love, but limits those possible connections from who cannot afford the exorbitant cost of membership. Please Bumble - return the aforementioned features to your free users, or you will lose many more users than you gain.
title: Bumble Hates it's Free Users

I think we are all aware of the tension in politics that has happened in the last few years. You go on dating apps and everyone has their political views listed. Well someone most likely read what my bio had to say and decided to report me for ‚Äúabuse‚Äù. The fact that there are people on these apps that are actual victims of abuse is what makes this disgusting. It‚Äôs fine to disagree with someone but to falsely report their account to have it deleted is something else. 

 I messaged bumble customer support directly about this and they were not willing to listen to my side of the story. This app goes in line with cancel culture and has double standards for the users of its app. What I had on my bio was nowhere near controversial as to the stuff I would read about killing cops, causing harm to people with more right wing political views, etc. 

This app needs to review it‚Äôs rules and what it considers to be abuse, violence and hate-speech. And it also needs to do more homework and better investigation on when someone falsely reports an account. The fact that my account was taken down but there are others with worse things on there is disgusting.

We‚Äôll make sure your positive feedback is heard by the rest of the team! üíõ', 'modified': '2021-08-29T13:19:50Z'}
review: It takes a little getting used to the app to learn the features, but it is good, overall.  It would be nice if it had a tutorial for those of us who never tried Tinder and are new to this style.  I appreciated the selfie verification system, which seems to have lowered the amount of scammers just using stock photos and claiming to be that person.  Free members can select only two filters for their search, but since you can see if someone is verified from the blue symbol next to their name, you don‚Äôt really need to waste one on that.  I also appreciate that conversations are initiated by the women.  This allows me to reach out to only people I am interested in and decreases the amount of shallow ‚Äúhi beautiful‚Äù opening lines I have to deal with.  (Seriously guys, stop commenting on a woman‚Äôs appearance in your very first words to her.) Bumble lets you message others if you have a match, even if you are a free member.  You can‚Äôt see who has liked you without upgrading, though, so you will only see that someone liked you if you match.  I actually prefer this a lot!
title: Pretty good app, even for free members

developerResponse: {'id': 38984812, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2023-09-18T12:56:25Z'}
review:
I downloaded this app to make friends and am very disappointed after attempting to use Bumble BFF.

I am nonbinary and the BFF section of the app only allows you to view people who share the same gender as you. Being that we are are such a small percentage of the population, this only allows me to see very few people in my area (practically none). I wrote to support explaining the issue and asking if I could have three option of selecting who I want to be friends with since I do not use gender to determine who will be a friend. They refused to accommodate my request and said they only allow you to match with your same gender to discourage misuse of the app. I feel this practice only caters to one demographic and the issue could easily be resolved by them allowing users to select which genders they are open to being friends with, similar to how other apps do it. It‚Äôs clear they only care about satisfying one demographic and couldnt care less about anyone else.

They also refused to update my name despite me telling them it‚Äôs my deadname. They insisted I show ID when I explained my IDs only have my deadname. I also don‚Äôt want to share my personal info with them such as my passport. I was willing to verify my pictures are real and that should have been enough.
title: The app is not inclusive

developerResponse: {'id': 25644515, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for giving us this feedback, and we'll be sure to pass it on to our Product Team so we can continue to improve the app. In the meantime our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport) so we can get you back up and buzzin'.", 'modified': '2021-10-12T17:26:52Z'}
review:
App limits swipes more than other apps and counts left swipes as part of the total swipe limit. 
It almost feels like you‚Äôre penalized for not paying for the app. What the app offers doesn't warrant the prices for their premium memberships. I‚Äôve also experimented with the options and they sometimes lock potential matches that fit all of your filters behind your beehive and won‚Äôt show them to you no matter how many times you swipe.
There‚Äôs no real time limit given when you run out of swipes. This could work against them when people have notifications turned off and live busy lives. Out of sight out of mind and they‚Äôre are more and better interactive apps.
Overall the UX and UI is good, but as all things, could use some improvement. The time spent on the app is limited due to low swipe limit and 24hour match jail. Also, their prices and mistakes they make with purchases doesn‚Äôt help their cause. Also, I didn‚Äôt get a vaccination option like other people, which is a bug that I can‚Äôt fix without deleting my account. They do a lot of things right, but the few things they lack really hit the user experience in the gut. 
3 stars
title: Review

developerResponse: {'id': 38771560, 'body': "We know that from time to time people can get busy or feel nervous starting a chat and this can be frustrating if you are really interested in the connection! That's why we give our members one free Extend per day in the hopes it will give those who need it a little more time to start the chat. You can learn more here: https://bit.ly/3llOnmI. We'd love to address all of your concerns, please message us at @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook. Alternatively, you can contact us via bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2023-09-07T06:05:08Z'}
review: Well to start off, an app where you expect women my age to start a conversation or contribute efforts to first talks is laughable so that already drops my rating to a 3 star. Sadly any matches that most of us will get are either spam accounts, people promoting their nudes to sell and scam people, or possibly tiny portions of REAL people that are not ready for any sort of engagement let alone a relationship.  Hence, you wait 20 hours for their vanity and ego boost then they unmatch. Another problem I encountered was the castle wall of payments to even attempt to change that outcome. 30 likes, literally swipes to say i‚Äôm interested in talking, cost $100 freaking dollars. Your premium account price is akin to a Gold‚Äôs Gym membership or a nice meal I could‚Äôve spent on a date. 26 dollars a month isn‚Äôt breaking banks but it‚Äôs stupid considering what you‚Äôre giving. All these dating apps must be smoking meth, it is sad to see you set that steep a price and gatekeep what essentially is a gamble on a half built platform. My recommendation would be to try Hinge, I have spoken to and had nice dates with a few women and it didn‚Äôt cost me my kidney to arrange it. They were happy with the outcome as well, not being swamped by rich meandering narcissists or creeps because the platform takes care of that.
title: Disappointing

review: I finally caved into the ‚Äúonline dating‚Äù and what an absolute hoax‚Ä¶ This is pretty much what I‚Äôve heard Tinder has turned into. Made an account and was told to ‚Äúget swiping‚Äù so I can find matches, then was told I was over-swiping and got locked from swiping for a week. They claim to discourage over-swiping unless you pay ridiculous money for a monthly service, this also includes seeing who has swiped you. I get excited for a notification daily that two people ‚Äúliked‚Äù me today, but it‚Äôs the same two people from when I first signed up and they aren‚Äôt ‚Äúnew‚Äù likes at all. Stop sending the same notification like it‚Äôs new‚Ä¶ Girls get on this app and then meet somebody, but never remember to delete their account; so you‚Äôre just swiping on somebody who will never even see it. I strategically only swipe on accounts that say ‚Äúnew here‚Äù but that only lasts a week or two. At least you actually have a chance at connecting with a person that looks at their account. Also, the female always messages first and it‚Äôs just opposite of human nature. More connections would be made if men could make the first move. I understand and appreciate the concept but it simply doesn‚Äôt make sense unless it‚Äôs a hook-up app.
title: Scam app

review:
Now that I let the app end all of the sudden now I‚Äôm getting all sorts of likes. This has happened on multiple occasions. Stop paying for the app. Then you get likes left and right. Pay them to see the likes. Then respond to the people who like you then they immediately unlatch with you. 
Keep this up I‚Äôll see you in court. 
Believe me bumble. I have the lawyers and the finances to retire off your company that uses and lies to people. 
You‚Äôre praying on people for your greed. I‚Äôm seriously thinking about a class action lawsuit taking place in your very near future. 
This app is full of bots and to even be seen you have to constantly pay to be on the spotlight. Once you do that you get all sorts of likes from people. Which you try to match with and then they don‚Äôt match back. Even though they are the ones who swiped on you to match. Or they match with you and give you very robotic bot questions. developerResponse: {'id': 22818001, 'body': "Thanks for your feedback, we'll be sure to pass this along to our Product Team to consider in the future. If you didn't already know, we provide each user with one free Extend per day, and with a Boost or Premium subscription users can Extend an unlimited number of matches and even Rematch with expired connections.", 'modified': '2021-05-15T01:56:42Z'}
review: Bumble does what it can to bring quality to dating via online. I think some improvements could be made with the 24 hour response rule. This just is simply too short of a window. Bumble promotes the app as a woman empowered app where we should go out in the world and be the baddest Bees we can be! Yet, we‚Äôre supposed to be tied to our phone waiting for that match to come in and then message within 24 hours. I feel this goes against what Bumble preaches. Sometimes I‚Äôm a busy bee taking on the world at work and don‚Äôt have time to message someone within 24hours and the same for bumble guys. I think, not sitting on a match forever is right on, but I suggest a ‚Äú3-day rule‚Äù for initial responses. Give people time to have balance with dating and other life responsibilities. Also, why can men extend a match for 24h but women cannot? The app says if a match expires you can have a chance to match again but why would I swipe again on a person that either ignored me or ran out of time the first time? That basically makes women continue to throw themselves at men... just saying.
title: 24 hour rule is outdated.

developerResponse: {'id': 38148411, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2023-08-07T15:36:11Z'}
review:
It‚Äôs got finer control over non-paywall functions than Tinder-as in, I can fill my profile out a bit more, but man, today I logged in, swiped ONCE and was told ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre out of likes for now‚Äù and was prompted to pay monthly if I wanted more. 

There needs to be some sort of hard timer that the end user can see that lets you know ‚ÄúHey, you‚Äôve got this much time before you can swipe right again‚Äù. But that would defeat the point of artificially restricting swipes-and it‚Äôs not because Bumble encourages ‚Äúconscious‚Äù swiping. A restriction like this and lack of a visible way to tell when you can swipe again encourages engagement with the algorithm and pushes you to pay their insane monthly subscription cost. 

It‚Äôs honestly just gonna drive me to engage with Tinder more or just disengage from online dating apps entirely. Especially when, after you‚Äôve paid that monthly subscription, they trip over themselves to offer you a half priced month the next month, since-again let‚Äôs be honest-you‚Äôre gonna sub and cancel to avoid getting charged twice. The ‚Äú50% off‚Äù is the real price, but you gotta pay through the nose to get that offer.
title: It‚Äôs alright

developerResponse: {'id': 25645288, 'body': "Hi there! We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2021-10-12T18:29:28Z'}
review: Can‚Äôt complain about the app itself. I‚Äôve been enjoying it and decided to get premium for a month. I travel somewhat often and started experiencing issues with the location updating back to my home city after returning. I reached out to the support team and it would take 1-2 days to get a response of a suggestion to change a setting or restart. Still, my location would not update. After 3 or so emails, I reinstalled the app one day and that seemed to fix the issue. I asked if I could have premium extended since it took close to 2 weeks since my initial email. I was told it was sent to their billing team to review. No answer or update. I sent a follow up email. No answer or update. Yesterday I went out of town and upon returning am experiencing again the issue with the location not updating to my home city. I was disappointed with the lack of communication and support from the support/billing team. Definitely do not feel premium was worthwhile since I only got to really use it for 50% of the month. Outside of that issue, the app is good and facilitated me meeting a few new people.
title: Good App but slow support service with bug

While we continue to work hard to improve this, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-07-22T11:43:23Z'}
review:
Unfortunately to avoid being accused of a ‚Äòhate crime‚Äô by writing this review I have to make it clear that I have no contempt or dislike for anyone who feels like they want to be a different gender. I frankly don‚Äôt care and it‚Äôs none of my business.
 I selected Man seeking Women when I set up the app, obviously. I assume anyone showing up in my feed or intentionally interacting with me is a woman seeking men.  I am currently locked on a screen unable to use the app until I  declare my gender again. There are three options of course,  because that is the entire point. I must acknowledge that gender is a choice or not be allowed to use the app.  Presumably I would  get some kind of badge or ribbon on my profile signifying my compliance. There is no practical reason for this  except to signal that I am politically obedient.  Again, to be clear: It‚Äôs not people who are confused about their gender or want to change their gender or the one in a hundred million people who are born hermaphrodites  that I have a problem with. It‚Äôs  the heavy handed political litmus test- the virtual arm band signifying my loyalty to the cause that offends me. This craziness has gone too far. So since my choices are to either comply or delete the app I am choosing to delete the app. Its not very good anyway.
title: Forced to comply

developerResponse: {'id': 27514769, 'body': 'We‚Äôre thrilled you made such a special connection in the Hive! Please tell us more about your story at bumble.com/success. üíõ', 'modified': '2022-01-18T14:12:30Z'}
review: My advice with this app would be to focus on building a strong profile, and when you find someone that seems like a good fit, jump on the opportunity right away because the good ones go quick. Patience is a virtue that you must have when it comes to any online dating app. I have been on several first dates through bumble and not all of them are home run connections, but with patience and persistence you will prevail in finding the right person. I also find that it helps to get their phone number early on and FaceTime or at least talk on the phone before going out because it's really hard to gauge someone's energy through text alone. I met my current girlfriend on here, and we were both starting to feel a bit hopeless about ever finding the right person until we met and have now finally deleted the app. I feel like we have a stronger connection than any girlfriend I've ever had prior and have a good feeling about this one. Good luck and happy bumbling!
title: Met my current girlfriend on here

developerResponse: {'id': 25027517, 'body': 'Sounds like the recipe for a perfect match!! We‚Äôd love to hear more of the deets at bumble.com/stories. üêù', 'modified': '2021-09-10T15:23:03Z'}
review: I have to admit I DID NOT think for even a second a dating app would be useful in my life. I had just suffered a bad break up and honestly downloaded the app cause I wanted to finally get back into the dating scene and just kinda meet and talk to a bunch of people. Basically live up the single mingle life but this app actually connected me with the most wonderful person I‚Äôve ever met within a week of using it. I tried the other apps but none of them seemed to have the right filters and sent really weird and creepy people my way. This one was actually nice and accommodating. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this one has a few people just looking for a hook up but I like that you can put that in your description so people know you don‚Äôt want the long term yet. Also it seems like people are more genuine on this app as well. I definitely recommend. It gives results and it gives them well. I‚Äôve been with the person I met on here for a year now and things are going great so definitely give it a shot!
title: Surprisingly Effective

review:
The application is OK but has room for improvement. The UIIs not as intuitive as it could be. Also there are some bugs and inconsistencies.
1Entering this review I selected two stars. It served me into a different screen with three stars. So I had to force it back to two.
2There is an inconsistency between the app and the website where by multiple choices can be made on the app but on the website version every option that comes up do use are a force to select one from the list not multiple.
3. And the biggest problem with the application is there is no ability for the user to select things like body type or Skin color. Just about everyone has a preference in terms of skin color of the person they want to date in a serious way. It doesn‚Äôt make them racist. not having that is a major problem for this application. 
4. it would be a good idea for people that select long-term relationship or marriage to be able to specify their own income bracket as well as the income bracket for the person they might seriously consider. money is absolutely part of the equation. Anyone that tells you otherwise is lying or a fool
title: review

developerResponse: {'id': 34024047, 'body': "Hi there. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-12-31T15:01:57Z'}
review: I‚Äôve used Bumble on and off for years. During that time I‚Äôve lived in smaller cities, Savannah, GA and Iowa City, IA. I‚Äôve also lived in very large ones, Houston,TX and Chicago,IL. While I obviously did get a few more matches in the larger areas the overall experience was the same. For reference I am a 40 year old male as of 2022. The only matches I get are with in the first week to two weeks of being on the app. After that your profile gets buried at the bottom of the card stack. So when there are so many men using the app, make users far outnumber female users as with any dating app, once you‚Äôre at the bottom of the stack the likelihood of you being seen is next to zero. It‚Äôs set up that way so that you‚Äôll pay for the app and pay for profile boosts and super likes. One draw to the app was that women had to message first, now as a make user you can send a message with a like. So now you are back to the the same as all other apps. As with all other dating apps and all other businesses in general making money and making a profit come first, second and third. Providing a service comes last and no one cares whatsoever wether or not you find a mate or have a good experience.
title: Used to be a good app

developerResponse: {'id': 38346411, 'body': "We really appreciate you sharing your feedback!. We know our users are busy so all of our members have the opportunity to extend one match for an additional 24 hours. You can also extend unlimited matches with Bumble Boost and Bumble Premium! To make sure you don't miss any matches, head to your in-app settings to turn on your notifications.", 'modified': '2023-08-17T09:31:23Z'}
review: This use to be one of the better dating apps but with every new ‚Äúfeature‚Äù or update it gets a bit worse and worse. For example, why is it that I have five likes, and have had five likes for over four months? I know when you swipe left on a possible match they disappear from your likes, and if you swipe right you match with them. And yet I‚Äôve had five blurred out in my likes that have never shown up in my queue. That‚Äôs not okay. I don‚Äôt get many likes, so I need all the opportunities I can get. Another example, is why such a low swipe limit. I don‚Äôt go on often, probably once a week. So when I log on after getting a notification I got a match after about three days of not opening the app, why am I out of likes after five swipes? Now I have to wait a full 24 hours just to get what another 10 swipes. Why doesn‚Äôt it reset each day regardless of how many swipes you did the day before? Dating app has become a gatcha mobile game where you have to log on everyday to receive your daily reward. That‚Äôs not how dating should work, and that‚Äôs not how apps promoting dating should work.
title: Became worse

developerResponse: {'id': 22235257, 'body': 'Our team fully investigates all reports before taking action and moderates based solely on our Community Guidelines. We would never arbitrarily block someone from our platform. If you would like our team to review your case, message @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook.', 'modified': '2021-04-14T08:31:41Z'}
review: I‚Äôve had this app for years. At times I‚Äôve even paid for premium subscriptions, and all in all, it‚Äôs my ‚Äòfavorite‚Äô as far as ease of use, response from matches and overall connections that I‚Äôve made. I have connections in other towns, going back years- that I reach out to when traveling, and we meet up for dinner & drinks, hikes, any adventure really. Well yesterday I was in the middle of a conversation with a man and out of no where, was signed out of the app. I had to go through a verification process to get back in, but was given a screen that told me I had been blocked. Something about ‚Äòseveral complaints‚Äô of me selling something!?!? That‚Äôs absolutely not true and if someone has (falsely) reported me for such things, it‚Äôs just some lowlife scammer upset that I‚Äôm not responsive to his sob story about being ‚Äòstationed in Afghanistan on a peacekeeping mission while widowed and left with 2 young gorgeous children and a German Shepherd, just looking for a Mum to love them‚Äô. So just like that, I lose all of my connections and am locked out of my account with no recourse? Is there no way to appeal this? I‚Äôm not now or ever selling anything here, or anywhere else for that matter. There needs to be a better way, Bumble.
title: Was blocked for NO reason

developerResponse: {'id': 30629903, 'body': "Thanks for reaching out to us! Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members. We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-06-29T22:41:48Z'}
review:
I use bumblebff and overall It‚Äôs a good app and concept and I have met people through it, but at this point in my life (I‚Äôm a lesbian) I‚Äôd really just like to make some male friends specifically and they just don‚Äôt give you that option at all on bumble bff. On dating you can choose to see men or women, but that‚Äôs it. I think that‚Äôs pretty unfair and non inclusive. If a guy goes on bumble bff and tries to come onto women, allow us to report that ONE guy and maybe implement some sorta ‚Äúthree strikes and you‚Äôre banned‚Äù rule or sumn idk, but to just completely cut off our ability to even attempt to befriend the opposite sex is kinda backwards. 

Also, the gender incision is great when it comes to what you can put in your bio, but that‚Äôs where it stops. If I put that I‚Äôm non-binary, I still have to choose to show my profile to people looking for men or women‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.Make it make sense‚Ä¶.
I think filters should be opened up way more, ESPECIALLY on the bff side. Sometimes I specifically want to find more non-binary friends, or trans male friends etc. it‚Äôs a good concept but I‚Äôd like to see a lot of changes too before I could really use it for what I want right now‚Ä¶
title: Ok‚Ä¶

We‚Äôd love to address all of your concerns, please message us at @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook. Alternatively, you can contact us via bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2023-08-17T11:40:09Z'}
review:
This is more of a suggestion, but it‚Äôs ruining my experience. The swipe is too sensitive on this app, which is really frustrating considering you limit the amount of likes we can send. I‚Äôve accidentally swiped ‚Äúright‚Äù on several users when I‚Äôm simply trying to scroll down to read their profile. It‚Äôs really annoying considering I run out of likes when I finally find someone I‚Äôm interested in. I also recommend that you don‚Äôt delete people that have ‚Äúliked‚Äù me when I swipe left on them. It took me a while to figure out that was happening, and I thought people were unliking me because I had flaws on my profile. I just feel like this app is not very intuitive, and doesn‚Äôt make a lot of sense. And if only women can message first, don‚Äôt limit how many people we can swipe right on.

Edit: I see your response, and it‚Äôs not addressing the actual issue; what y‚Äôall consider a ‚Äúswipe‚Äù is still too sensitive and it wastes my limited swipes. Again, I scroll down and your app acknowledges that as a ‚Äúright swipe‚Äù when I‚Äôm simply trying to scroll down and read. Fix that.
title: Major Flaw with Swipes

developerResponse: {'id': 24526921, 'body': "Hi there, we really appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-08-16T10:25:48Z'}
review: This app is great in theory, but it literally makes it impossible for you to keep your matches. I love that you can see more detailed bios from potential matches because it gives me a little more to work with when approaching a guy I match with. However, the 24 hr thing is terrible. Yes, it puts the onus on the girl to take a leap and make the first move. But, many articles have shown that most people who use a dating app, don‚Äôt check it regularly and/or have the notifications turned off for the app. So, if you match with a person and take a little while to finally get the courage to send them something, the person may not even be on there within the 24 hrs that you send them the message and your conversation just dies before you even have a chance! Back to square one. And who knows, that person could‚Äôve been a good match. If you‚Äôre going to put a time limit on it, make it something like 72 hrs. If someone doesn‚Äôt answer in 72 hrs, then  they‚Äôre just not interested. I don‚Äôt know, it feels like the opposite of ‚Äú,empowering women,‚Äù to constantly be disappointed and discouraged by having a match go cold before it even has a chance to develop‚Ä¶
title: Great in Theory

developerResponse: {'id': 39501756, 'body': "We'd be more than happy to take a second look into your original inquiry for you. Can you please reach out to our team at bumble.com/contact with a follow-up message so our team can look into this right away. We're here to help!", 'modified': '2023-10-13T15:56:38Z'}
review:
Until yesterday I might‚Äôve given Bumble four stars, maybe five. I like that it‚Äôs a woman first app, and I‚Äôve met several people that were good, decent, interesting. Schedules, distance, time, schedules, opposites, etc. While I haven‚Äôt found the love of my life, it‚Äôs the only dating app I use.
THEN Sunday, I am an hour out from meeting a new person. He had given me his phone number in the app chat, then tried to call him through the app twice, I got a error message that said we had to chat first which clearly we already had. then when I tried to send one more message, it send a message failed. 
I hit the back button and then the person/match disappeared completely. Imagine the panic of now we can‚Äôt meet and he might think that I unmatched him. When I emailed, since there‚Äôs no one to call, I didn‚Äôt get a response for 72 hours, I think that‚Äôs ridiculous considering it was clearly an app/system error. When I finally got a reply, it said their system looks good on their end and there‚Äôs lots of other people joining match every day and that I should keep looking.
That is not a solution. Contact both of us, see if we still want to be matched, he already gave me his phone number and we were about to meet! Ridiculous!
title: No help

If you have any other suggestions feel free to contact our team at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2023-04-13T13:00:48Z'}
review: Don‚Äôt get this if you‚Äôre a woman who‚Äôs scared to initiate and maintain conversation with men. It‚Äôs the main premise of the app. They made oneeeeee app for the guys to feel loved. Overall, the app interface is fine. It‚Äôs not complicated to understand and set up your preferences. My main issue is that there is barely ANY interaction. Extending the time limit for a match hoping to contact you is pointless - they do not respond 99% of the time. It‚Äôs just built up anticipation thinking someone you match with will write to you when you know they will not. Waiting for someone to contact you is not the way to get people to know each other. Bumble has made me hate online dating. I had way better luck and went on actual dates on other dating apps like Hinge.

I ran into SO MANY catfish accounts of guys who ‚Äúreally want to meet me‚Äù and they‚Äôd make plans with me but keep cancelling because surprise surprise they‚Äôre not real. This whole app is a big scam and a time waster. 

The verified profiles don‚Äôt really mean anything when I‚Äôve disproven many of these accounts. So I don‚Äôt feel safe at all on this app. I had to report a couple of profiles and the bumble team assured me that they are gone. But if that person is a catfish or a fake account and your verification process can‚Äôt be trusted, then how do I know if that person doesn‚Äôt just make a new account. The guys on here don‚Äôt want to date they just swipe right and hope you match with them. Then talk to you for a second and then ghost you for no reason. It‚Äôs ridiculous.

review: I quite enjoyed this app and met many people until I was suddenly blocked as a result of ‚Äúanonymous‚Äù complaints of policy violations that they continuously refuse to explain to me.
