I really don‚Äôt understand who exactly is being protected because it certainly wasn‚Äôt me. I‚Äôm a person with more strict moral standards than most, so there hasn‚Äôt been anything inappropriate in my profile nor my messages to anyone. I can‚Äôt begin to imagine what they think I did wrong, but they won‚Äôt explain or give me any evidence of my wrong doing. I work in a very legal influenced profession, and even when a crime is committed, the accused has a right to be told what their violations are and given an opportunity to respond. I find Bumble‚Äôs practice of vague, canned responses unreasonable, unhelpful and unprofessional. Not asking for anybody‚Äôs complaints to be shared, but a screenshot of whatever the violations were would certainly have been reasonable before banning someone altogether who has been using this app responsibly for years.

review:
So I pay for bumble. Then I pay for for super swipes. Apparently I am a match with a couple of but it only gives them 24 hours to message back and I just have to wait. I did have the opportunity to extend the time for another 24 hours. But It ran out. For some people finding a match is difficult. I feel like one of the main features is that women have the control over making the first move and also adding an additional time constraint on if unnecessary. To add insult to injury I have to watch the clock count down and really have nothing to do but watch it tick.  From my understanding I have expressed that I like her and she expressed that she like me via the app. For some reason this starts a clock. I am realistic and I know I'm not typically going to be the first choice. But by the time a lady may turn back to to the 2nd or 3rd choice. I have already disappeared. And all I can do is watch the clock.   
Another issue is the so called superswipe. I paid to buy these things and I have literally seen no difference in activity on my account. I don't know what it is supposed to do but it certainly doesn't help me get dates. Now I have used all of them and now they  seem to be more expensive to buy.
title: Watching the clock.

developerResponse: {'id': 25314977, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for bringing this to our attention. It's possible your subscription wasn't properly canceled. Please message @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook so we can check on this for you.", 'modified': '2021-09-25T15:41:11Z'}
review:
No way to cancel subscription!

I was traveling for work and thought I would check out the app since when I signed up there were tons of people on the site in the Bay Area. When my contract ended and I headed back north, there was next to no one using the app and I ran through users in a day. The next two months there was maybe one new user every two weeks, but the app still kept sending me random push notifications. I thought, ‚Äúwhatever, I will just let the subscription run out. It was only $67. Low and behold, I have been trying to cancel my subscription so I wouldn‚Äôt renew but there is no way to do it. I was just charged ANOTHER $67. I have gone through the process on the bumble website, tried all of the online walkthroughs both in-app and in Apple settings, none of the walkthroughs work. I do not have an option to cancel my subscription. I can only change my subscription to a different dollar amount after this new pay period ends, a minimum of $8 a month. 

A little reference about me, I am a designer with apps on the Apple store, so I do know how to use my phone. I went through the entire app and all Apple settings. There is no ‚Äúcancel subscription‚Äù option.
title: Do not subscribe to this app!

review: The dating platform itself is fairly well designed and effective, so no complaints there. My complaints are with the business practices Bumble, and unfortunately most dating apps, use. The one that caused me to write this review is this: SuperSwipes and Spotlights expire one week after a membership ends. This is extremely scummy. I got a one week membership and started talking with someone, so I did not use them. After that did not work out, I went to try and use my Spotlight and it was gone. No notification telling me to use it before it expired, nothing. This is beyond unfair as I paid for the week membership, SuperSwipes, and Spotlight, and I had 2/3 of that taken away from me without notice. I tried contacting support, where I found out about this expiration. I got a robotic apology for any ‚Äúinconvenience‚Äù, but that doesn‚Äôt change the fact Bumble took away things I paid for because of an arbitrary and unethical expiration date. I am extremely disappointed in the business practices behind Bumble, and I hope more consumers begin demanding better from these services. As seen here, they are not ethical in the slightest, and Bumble will not be receiving another cent from me until these things change
title: Anti-Consumer Business Practices

We ask all Success Stories to submit theirs at bumble.com/success, and we‚Äôd love to hear yours!  üíõ", 'modified': '2022-05-24T23:23:28Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been online dating for over 10 years using site‚Äôs like Plenty of Fish (crappy format), Tinder (trash!), OK Cupid, and FB Dating, but Bumble seems to work the best. By only allowing women to send the first message they tend to be more serious about their interest in you. It is a numbers game though and you have to swipe like mad to get only a few matches. Don‚Äôt expect every message to go to a date though. The more genuine you are the better results you‚Äôll get. This means guys: quit lying about your age, use YOUR pics and recent ones, quit asking for nudes and sending D-pics. Pro Tip: only pay for a week at a time and swipe like mad. The algorithms on the site tend to give you more matches for a few days and then it fizzles out. Let your ‚Äòlikes‚Äô that you cannot see unless you pay build up, then pay for a week and surf through them. It could be weeks or months but if you stick with it you‚Äôll have some good experiences and great dates. Good luck!

review: About 5 years ago this app was pretty great. I was easily finding people with the filters I set and within the area radius I set. It was also half the price! This time around‚Ä¶ha! Good luck. I was constantly getting shown people who were over an hour away even though I checked and double checked my settings and even asked their support if I was doing something wrong. Their reply was that you had to set the distance as a deal breaker‚Ä¶which I did. No help. I don‚Äôt want to toot my own horn, but I‚Äôm a pretty attractive female and after 2 months I ended up with loads of likes from people who lived nearly 2 hours away and only a small handful of likes from locals. I do not live in a small town either. I‚Äôm almost positive this is on purpose. These online dating apps have algorithms for how they show your stack to you depending on paying/nonpaying profiles. The goal is to get you to pay and to keep you paying. I decided to try a different app (the one that‚Äôs meant to be deleted) along side Bumble and within a week I found someone who lives 10 mins from me and we‚Äôre now dating. Sorry Bumble, but you‚Äôve changed and it seems we‚Äôve grown apart‚Ä¶.so I‚Äôm breaking up with you!

developerResponse: {'id': 27584574, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-01-21T14:43:13Z'}
review: Bumble has the potential ,  it can be positive experience. But overall I‚Äôm disappointed. I think the biggest thing is time limit and women being able to make the first move. Okay first the time limit. I find that most ppl delete the app after few days of use. So matching with someone who might not be on the app during the time limit definitely kills this app. That person might not come on to bumble for another week but they give 24 hours to make a decision. That feature in my opinion is  killing the app the Dramatically. You matched with someone but come to find out you were late cause you didn‚Äôt engage with the app when the app wants you too. I do not  like that it  forces  you to make a move right now. Obviously this is what set bumble and tinder apart is women making the first move. And I can honestly say I met fewer women on this app then tinder due to this feature. I‚Äôm all for the empowerment of women but this ain‚Äôt it. These two things make the app very inconsistent from my experience. You match with few girls in a week. But they never say anything due to time limit and having to make the first move .
title: Why I don‚Äôt like bumble

review: There are people on this app who very clearly are lying about their age. For example a profile will say the person is in their 30‚Äôs but they are very clearly in there 50s or 60s. When those profiles are reported the response is something like ‚Äúif someone else reports the profile as we‚Äôll remove it.‚Äù They have a verification feature, but it is clear no one is actually verifying as I was able to identify someone as being a catfish and it seems this isn‚Äôt uncommon. They allow people to make accounts over and over again. I learned this after repeatedly blocking someone. When I brought this to their attention they initially began to remove the profile, but after the person continued to recreate the same profile at least a dozen times they stopped removing the profile and instead responded with something like ‚Äúif someone else reports the profile we‚Äôll remove it.‚Äù At that point I decided to delete my account. It‚Äôs against the terms and conditions to repeatedly make accounts, and for an app that prides itself in making women feel safe blocking ip addresses of people who do this so frequently in such a short period of time would make women think they take safety seriously.

I can‚Äôt cancel! Have contacted them multiple times letting them know my problem!  And they keep me subscribed! They kept telling what to do, but those options aren‚Äôt available. It‚Äôs the worst out of any app out there. It‚Äôs ridiculous they can‚Äôt cancel by you telling them to cancel!! They have extended my subscription 4-5 times already with out me even paying. What‚Äôs up with that. They should really make it a lot easier to cancel or just cancel if you ask them too!! I‚Äôve never delt with anything like this from any other app ever. Only this app,  Bumble, which I would give no stars to if I could. I hope they fix this problem, and I hope they finally cancel my subscription!! It‚Äôs a shame they won‚Äôt work with you on canceling!! So be very cautious when setting up for automatic renewal!!
title: Great site to meet! Horrible app to cancel!!

review:
Welp, it happened! 6 months ago I downloaded this app for one whole day, and met the love of my life. It might sound crazy, but it feels exactly like everything that‚Äôs happening is meant to. We connected and started dating during quarantine, and are moving in together next month. When you know, you know! 

I have used other dating apps in the passed, and putting aside the feature of the women starting the conversation, I felt even myself being more authentic and open to possibilities on Bumble than on other apps. Relationships aren‚Äôt always easy, dating isn‚Äôt always easy, and the added quarantine and societal pressures aren‚Äôt helping, but it can still happen. We have lots of mutual friends, and even some of the same hang out spots, and had never come across each other! Who knows how long we could have been together by now, but this app introduced me to people in my world but outside of my circle. He was right there the whole time, and I have Bumble to thank for making the connection. üíö
title: Love of my Life

Bumble was a Bust for me. I had a 30 day Premium subscription. Apparently, not many guys subscribed  in my area. Weird, since I live in metro area. Was offered surprisingly few potential Matches, even when Bumble stretched beyond my Preferences. Ones I liked never responded. I didn‚Äôt like that I was held captive to whoever Bumble sent me. I think this app is fantastic, the only thing I don‚Äôt like about it is the fact that women have to make the first move or else the connection is gone forever. On the dating end? Fine. I‚Äôve lost potentially great connections just because the female didn‚Äôt get the chance to reach out to me first. It doesn‚Äôt make any sense on the business end for this restriction. It can completely obliterate the opportunity for both the male and female and defeats the point of even having this business connection feature on the app. If you think about it, it doesn‚Äôt even really make sense on the dating platform either. We connected. She said yes, I said yes. Why are you adding a second layer to the process? It screws everything up.

Update: this still has not been fixed. It‚Äôs a bizarre addition and needs to be adjusted. Rating is also going from 3 stars to 2 because you constantly tell me someone liked me and that I‚Äôm ‚Äúone like away from a match!‚Äù And then there‚Äôs nobody there. review: I enjoy using Bumble. It‚Äôs a good app that‚Äôs easy to use and has a lot of members. However, there are definitely some issues I have with the app. First of all, I‚Äôm not a fan of the swipe to match feature. Sometimes I will accidentally swipe right when I meant to scroll down. There‚Äôs no way to undo it when you swipe right either. It would be nice if they had an option to turn off the swiping feature so people who didn‚Äôt want to swipe could still send matches by using the buttons on the bottom of the profiles. In addition, Bumble only gives you a few profiles to look at a time. Once you‚Äôve looked through about 4 profiles, you‚Äôll need to wait before looking through more. I don‚Äôt know why I can‚Äôt look through as many as I want at a time especially when I‚Äôm paying for the subscription. Finally, I believe you can only send 1 compliment per day to someone. This is very limiting as I don‚Äôt believe you can even purchase the option to send more compliments. Overall, I enjoy using Bumble but it definitely needs some improvement.

I really enjoyed using Bumble for the first year, which is why I‚Äôll still give 2 stars. I got about 5-10 likes per week‚Äîmore if I used a Spotlight. Last month, I started using a VPN to keep myself secure, and all of a sudden I stopped getting likes at all except for when I use a Spotlight (I‚Äôll still get about 10 likes in 2.5 hours). I‚Äôm not saying I‚Äôm the most desirable person ever, but to go from 5-10 likes/week to zero is pretty weird. I did some research and found a lot of people who stopped getting likes after they started using VPNs. The theory is that Bumble‚Äôs algorithm marks VPN users as spammers and keeps them out of others‚Äô feeds. Now my Bumble experience is totally screwed because I chose to protect my privacy online.

Update: I sent Bumble Support a message about this. They responded saying nothing was going on, but also I immediately went back to getting 5-10 likes per week ü§∑. I‚Äôll still give them four stars. Just send support a message if you‚Äôre in my position üòÇ
title: Don‚Äôt use Bumble if you use a VPN

It‚Äôs just another dating app tbh except the creators of this one are really proud of it. I can‚Äôt see how they justify $50/month for a subscription. You can use it for free, but you can‚Äôt see who liked you and there‚Äôs limitations to other features. 

The user interface is smooth, easy to use, and looks good, which is nice. There is also some cool features like speed dating, which I haven‚Äôt seen other apps do, but tbh the biggest negative for me is the cost of a subscription. I have the tendency to buy the subscriptions for some apps for like a month at a time once in a while, so I can play with the premium features, but the price is just too much here. It‚Äôs got me double checking sometimes to see if it‚Äôs still that expensive, like maybe I misread it. You‚Äôve got to offer something that stands out from the competition in order to justify a price like that. Not when Hinge or even FB dating has most of the same features like undoing a dislike and seeing who liked you for no cost. 

Just my thoughts though. I‚Äôll still use it, but just nothing premium
title: It‚Äôs okay

review:
I‚Äôve stayed friends with several of the guys that I‚Äôve met on here - because I can select for education.      But I will echo other reviewers that I haven‚Äôt met a single person on here that does not meet DSM criterial for a mental health disorder. 
The app seems to self select for these folks. 
I‚Äôve meet someone clinically depressed with a Master‚Äôs in his 40s who refuses to treat it. 
I‚Äôve meet multiple codependents and even a sex addict, high functioning otherwise. If they had even once been to the shrink they‚Äôd know it. As a 36 year old former District Attorney who has had to regularly address mental health at my job, the people you will meet on this particular app will typically not be criminals theives wife beaters but the app selects for people who are not well rounded. It seems like nobody on here is just working with a job and ready to date. It seems like everyone on here is looking for a person to fullfil an emptiness that comes from within - hard core on this app it is a real problem.
title: Mental Health

review: My mom raised me to be a extremely respectful person to women as did my sisters which I have 3 of. review: Such shady advertising! They offered me a ‚Äúdeal‚Äù to pay to unlock unlimited swipes exactly one profile before they told me ‚ÄúThats‚Äôs everyone‚Äù so there are no more profiles to see! What a scam! I just upgraded to the latest version, and now it pops up an ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù ad that must be dismissed every single time I come back to the app, which is sometimes every 30 seconds! review: As a man, Bumble is heavily favored to women. The app is designed well, love the simplicity of how your profile is presented but beside that this app is disappointing. You barely get any likes per day. Probably about 20 or so which you will go through fairly quick but it gets worse. If you swipe right on women you find attractive the algorithm will assume you‚Äôre just mindlessly swiping right for matches and will reduce your available likes even more. The reason is to ‚Äúkeep the connections genuine‚Äù absolutely ridiculous and a greedy ploy to force you to upgrade to their overpriced premium model for unlimited swipes. On top of that when you get a match you have to wait for the women to message you first which hardly ever happens, they just sit there and let the match expire. It‚Äôs nice that you can extend but that hardly ever changes the lack of messages form the women. If you do manage to get a message, it‚Äôs always hey, then you never hear from them again or the conversation expires if you don‚Äôt message them within 24 hours. Overall you‚Äôll have better luck with their competitors on Tinder or Hinge.

review: I initially felt that the good of this app outweighed the bad, and made it a superior choice over other dating apps. I like how the profiles go into more detail, allowing you to know more about users before making your choice, but my favorite thing about the app was the option to filter so that you only saw users with qualities and traits that you are looking for. Being able to filter for height allowed me to narrow the amount of people I saw down to a manageable number. Filtering for what users are looking for prevented me from wasting time swiping through people with different intentions than me. Required profile questions allowed me to learn more about users before I made a decision, which was a big reason that I found bumble the most appealing dating app. Without these features bumble is no better than any of the other apps out there and I might as well switch to other apps that don‚Äôt require women to speak first and let matches expire before a busy person has a chance to reach out if I‚Äôm going to have to swipe through every man in the entire city anyway.
title: Bring back the free advanced filter

Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-09-18T16:16:10Z'}
review:
In all honesty, Bumble does make a good app. I prefer it Hinge and Match. You can put as much or as little information as you want, but I doubt it matters either way.

I‚Äôve been on this app for a few months and only got two likes from people who didn‚Äôt even match well with me. I ended up paying for Premium to see what likes I got, only to be disappointed. Unfortunately, the advanced filters don‚Äôt help much either. They narrow it down to a few people, but my main issue is that it gives me people WAY too far away for my liking. I have my distance set for 10-12 miles but I repeatedly get people 19-21 miles away, even with no advanced filters.

Bumble puts the right tools in front of you to find different people, but it doesn‚Äôt change the fact that at least half to three quarters of them either aren‚Äôt on the app or don‚Äôt acknowledge likes, which makes it incredibly hard to meet people on these apps. Like I said in the title, it‚Äôs bad, but it‚Äôs not Bumble‚Äôs fault. It‚Äôs the people on Bumble, Tinder, etc. And everyone wonders why they have issues dating‚Ä¶
title: It‚Äôs not good, but it‚Äôs not the app‚Äôs fault.

developerResponse: {'id': 39092883, 'body': 'Thank you for your message. For further assistance, please get in touch with our support team at: https://support.bumble.com/hc/en-us/requests/new. Thank you. üíõ', 'modified': '2023-09-23T12:15:27Z'}
review:
Initially, I really liked this app and the ability to be able to message first. Interesting spin on a dating app. However, I feel like the ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre generating quite the buzz‚Äù in your beeline, is a ploy to get you to upgrade your membership; when doing so, half the matches in your beeline don‚Äôt actually want to match with you. Whether this is a fault in the algorithm, a ploy to get you to upgrade, or just a design flaw in being able to inadvertently swipe right too easily without confirming whether or not you actually wanted to do so, I‚Äôm not sure. But it definitely needs addressing. 

Furthermore, the customer service was subpar at best. When I upgraded my subscription, I didn‚Äôt not have access to my beeline. I emailed customer service the same day and it took them two weeks to reply. I was eventually able to get back in, but only after 14 days had transpired. When I inquired about a refund, they told me they could not do so. They didn‚Äôt even try to extend my subscription for the days I was unable to use the app. For these I will never use this app again and will NOT be recommending it to anyone I know.
title: Misleading & Poor Customer Service

review: I just tried sending my 4th message. I have yet to have anyone reach out to help me. This is the worst customer service experience I have ever had. I first messaged on 10/14 and received an automated email telling me someone would reach out to me within 48 hours, nobody ever did. After 48 hours I messaged 3 different times restating my issue and none of these messages even got an automated reply back. Today I received an email from bumble asking to take a short survey and rate how the service I received was, I was never answered by anyone! I tried out the week of premium unaware it was a subscription, it‚Äôs not made very clear. And when it was up on the 13th, the same day I was sedated and wheeled into surgery I was charged for a whole additional week which I absolutely do not want and did not plan to use and did not use because I had surgery and was healing. I wanted a refund for that second week I was charged. That week has already come and gone because nobody at their team is responding. I couldn‚Äôt be more upset and frustrated. I used bumble a few years ago and enjoyed it but this experience has tainted the whole app for me.
title: Horrible Customer Service!

review:
Let‚Äôs try this again since my last review was deleted Bumble, like many other dating apps, employs a freemium model, offering basic features for free while enticing users to pay for premium services. While profitability is essential for any business, Bumble's strong emphasis on monetization at times overshadows the user experience. The continuous push for premium subscriptions and in-app purchases can sometimes detract from the platform's primary purpose of connecting individuals.

Bumble's unique approach and focus on female empowerment have contributed to its popularity, it is important to acknowledge the impact of its profit-driven approach on customer experience. The app's heavy emphasis on monetization, limited free features, technical issues, inadequate customer support, and intrusive advertising are areas where Bumble falls short in prioritizing its user base. As a consumer, it's crucial to consider these factors when deciding whether Bumble aligns with your expectations and preferences for a dating app. That being said look forward to the generic response of contacting customers supporting via Facebook, twitter üò©üò©
title: Emphasis on Monetization

I had a bumble all of last year through the pandemic. It was great, I got multiple likes, matches, and dates out of it. I then hit a rough patch and took a break from dating and stopped using my account for a few months. Once I got back on my feet I wanted to put myself
out there and start dating again. I wanted a fresh start so I deleted and recreated my account. Since doing so, I might only get 3-4 likes per a week which is a drastic decrease. I‚Äôm using the exact same profile pictures and prompts that I did last year, only now my profile has almost no activity, and the amount of swipes bumble gives you on a daily basis is now extremely low. This app really fell off. I did some research and found that a lot of other people have had the same issue when deleting and recreating their profiles. Apparently it‚Äôs called ‚Äúshadow banning,‚Äù which either has the app not show your profile, or show it at a minimum. It‚Äôs probably their way of forcing people to buy and pay for their ‚Äúspotlight‚Äù feature so their profiles get more attention. But either way, don‚Äôt bother with this app anymore. Go to hinge instead.

W: ___. Nothing. Bumble team, 
I want to thank you for creating this amazing platform! This has been a life changing experience for me. Personally, Bumble hasn‚Äôt only served a dating app, but it was a huge support in my liberation process. 
I have grown up in a extremely misogynistic community where I inherited most of the behaviors, self-concept, and everything about ‚Äúlove‚Äù and ‚Äúpartnership.‚Äù Unsurprisingly, this was a miserable time of my life, and after I reflected, it was all connected to my lack self awareness, self love, and boundaries. Getting bumble has shown a whole world of opportunities. It taught me the magic of moving on, accepting rejection, setting boundaries and never negotiating with less than I deserve, and most importantly that there‚Äôs always someone else, always. 
This process has freed me from my fears, anxieties, and the misogyny that had controlled me for 3 decades. Thank you for being with me on this journey and helping me love life ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Life Changing

Few people that match with you on dating apps these days have any interest in actually meeting in person. Most are just looking for new Instagram followers and many will just constantly insist on engaging in pointless small talk in text and avoid the subject whenever you want to actually meet up in person to get to know each other. LA is already a tough place to find anyone with depth, but apps like these honestly fuel a certain disdain for the opposite sex (on both sides, I know dudes have their problems too). 

Bumble, like Tinder also doesn‚Äôt show your profile barely at all after the first few days. I went from getting 10+ likes every day to barely getting 2 in a week. They just try to encourage you to pay extra for their features that should just be part of the app in general. Dating apps are scams, It would be nice to go on one that was actually interested in getting people to go on dates and not just spend extra time on their phones leading to absolutely nothing but a slightly lowered self esteem and opinion of others.

title: NOT just the guys who hate the app US WOMEN ARE FED UP TOO

review: I really do love the idea of this app. I think most men in 2022 want women to be more empowered in the dating process. I just wish they took this opportunity. Sadly, the reality is that Bumble exposes womens‚Äô lack of desire or commitment to the idea of being the chaser. I would get several matches a day and 10% would write nothing and 89% would write ‚Äúhey‚Äù or a wave emoji. Only 1% would actually start a conversation. Basically, in my not-so-polically-correct opinion, it seems that women on Bumble would rather pass the onus back onto the man instead of taking the reigns the way the app was designed! As a result, I‚Äôve had far less meaningful conversations compared to Bumble‚Äôs competitors. I‚Äôm sure there must be a way Bumble can address this issue but they have never put any effort into adding prompts or questionnaires or giving women any leg up on the pickup game. After all, they put the ball in womens‚Äô court here. Shouldn‚Äôt they help get things rolling a bit if women won‚Äôt take the initiative? Until they figure it out, I‚Äôll be on other apps starting conversations on my own.

review:
This is a small review on my month experience.

1. Speed dating game.
If you don‚Äôt pay and search without spotlight you end up getting around 3-4 chats. If you do it with spotlight you most likely get 4-8. If you don‚Äôt pay for spotlight you are wasting your time. I‚Äôve tried the speed dating multiple times without spotlight and checked every single person I‚Äôve talked with and not a single match made. It‚Äôs clearly a scam which you‚Äôll only get a match or two if you are paying for spotlight.

2. Matches
As I‚Äôve said I‚Äôve had this app for a month. I‚Äôm that month I only had one match. Just one! And pretty sure it was a fake account by bumble for false hopes to keep me using their app. I gave the person additional time but at least I go no answer.

3. Profiles
Unless you pay can you get verified accounts but nothing says they aren‚Äôt fake accounts by bumble or other users. So unless you pay do you really have additional chances of meeting someone

Overall:
I‚Äôve used tinder before. Banned on day two like many others for posting memes. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend getting this app unless you don‚Äôt mind waiting an year of your life to get on here. I‚Äôve got better chances of an real life match just going for it so bye bumble. Giving this five stars so I hope some that read this got some useful insight on how this app works.

It‚Äôs also not accurate that women will even give out their number after several weeks of chatting and video calls. For many women finding a man that‚Äôs actually available it seems is their worst fear. I‚Äôm willing to pursue, and express interest, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs absurd to want a partner to also express a desire to be with me. Women on the app will report you for telling them you don‚Äôt think you guys are a match, all the while stringing you along with no intention of actually dating you. review: I get that hookup culture has ruined the game so much that you developed your whole app around making the woman be the deciding factor in it all. I‚Äôve had plenty of matches, and I go out of my way to extend the matches an extra 24hrs cause I get they could be busy. And then turn around and let the time run out and nobody contacts anyone. It was a decent concept to begin with, but I have never had a woman just contact me after matching. I 100% have to make the first move and your app keeps me from doing that. title: Why?

review: This app used to be much better. Monetizing nearly every feature beyond swiping makes this app difficult to use. The things that made me prefer bumble to other apps are now paywalled. I‚Äôm not paying $25-50 to see potential matches, especially when the bumble format seems designed to make most men swipe right on every woman and decide later who they want to talk to. I can‚Äôt fault bumble for the extremely poor quality of its users, though I wish there was a better class of men on there. What I can say is the chat feature is quite slow to load. I don‚Äôt enjoy the chat experience because I don‚Äôt like the user interface. I also wish there was a way for people who live near country borders to block out people from other countries. My subscription just ran out today. All of a sudden I have 5 likes in my beeline which of course I can‚Äôt see because premium ran out. Also find it interesting that all of a sudden there is an influx of very attractive women whom I somehow hadn‚Äôt seen in the entire month I did have premium. Seems like a huge money making scheme to me. Pay pay pay, get no results til your subscription runs out, and then miraculously you start getting all these likes. The location only goes by where the person currently is not by where they actually live.  Which is pretty scary that the app tracks you wherever you go. title: Fake and garbage

review:
I‚Äôve used the Major Three apps on and off for two years. Bumble has been the worst of the three. Lot of old, abandoned profiles. Also noticing more and more bots. Not as bad as Tinder but pretty bad.

In general, this feels more like a ‚ÄúLonely Single Ladies Chat App‚Äù than a dating app where the expectation is to actually meet up. Also Bumble has leaned pretty hard into ‚Äúwoke‚Äù ‚Ä¶ so now every single woman is neurodivergent, non-binary, with whatever hashtag cause Bumble is giving out badges for ‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt necessarily have a problem with any of that, but it clearly creates a sort of trend surfing that more closely resembles TikTok. Just makes it that much harder to figure out how genuine people are.

On top of it ‚Äî the premium version has gotten more and more expensive, and the value is a lot less. I don‚Äôt mind dropping whatever a month if I am getting quality matches and going on dates pretty frequently. But don‚Äôt see the value when the matches aren‚Äôt there and every conversion either trails off or you get unmatched because you asked someone out instead of just ‚Ä¶ chatting.

review: I am just divorced and moving to a new, unfamiliar location. I thought this app would be a way to make new connections and start building a new circle of friends. I chose BFF thinking this was co-ed. I want friends - both sexes and maybe some casual dating with the opposite sex. BFF is same sex only - that was never mentioned and I am locked into BFF. If I wanted to date I needed to select relationship before buying the 3 month premium. It will also only connect you with people in your physical location using your phone‚Äôs location services. I want to make connections in the new location which I will only be in a few days at a time for the next couple months. You can only message customer service and you get an auto reply explaining how busy they are and they will try to get back to you in 48 hrs. I feel very ripped off. I should have read the reviews first. I am not alone in my complaints.

review: In order to find out who liked you, you have to pay $8 a week! I‚Äôm 20 years old, so I‚Äôm still going off of minimum wage. title: Most expensive digital subscription I‚Äôve ever seen in my life

developerResponse: {'id': 31242490, 'body': 'Thanks for letting us know we‚Äôre on the right track. Our team is constantly working hard to improve Bumble for our customers, so that means so much. We‚Äôll make sure your positive feedback is heard by the rest of the team! üíõ', 'modified': '2022-08-02T22:38:30Z'}
review:
In my experience Bumble has been pleasant. 
Not matching with someone; or them not matching you goes widely unnoticed on both ends, taking out a percentage of the rejection/rejecting factors, and enhances user experience. As there is no way for someone to see if they have been matched until they have been. 
Females get to message first after both parties have matched, this is done with in a 24 hour time period which can be extended by either party. Message prompts for matches with bumble interest options in common for those who may have a timid side to use. 
I highly suggest the lifetime membership as there is a sense of relief for those of us experienced enough to know it is best to take the time and not rush into a match. With a lifetime membership I have the availability to be particular, and to feel out bumble one day at a time with no time constrictions. ‚ÄúBumble, the way relationships are found online‚Äù. ‚ÄúSafe and discreet‚Äù -winter p.
title: 10 weeks of Bumble

developerResponse: {'id': 33905223, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-12-23T19:23:43Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve had my Bumble account for about three years now, and I have had some success in reaching men (as a woman) who were moderately active in their account. Unfortunately, like many apps, it has its downsides. 

The first of them being that the advertised pictures to coax you into downloading the app are nowhere near close to the photos you actually see, in terms of quality. You‚Äôll have very pixelated photos and the accuracy of the size(of the actually photo versus the size you are shown) is misleading. I like to see high quality pictures, but I understand now everyone has a high quality camera. When I see low quality, I think low interest in the actual usage/goal of the app and it‚Äôs user.

Secondly, you should not have to pay to have unlimited swipes. The point of a dating app is to see who you like based off their profile, not to ‚Äòsave‚Äô your likes for just the ones who really stand out. Same reason for advanced filters. 

The more positive note I have is that I have gotten more replies on here than anywhere else (by just a couple people), and some conversations have moved into different methods like texting or Snapchat. If anyone is downloading this for the first time, it may take a while to find someone you match with. I‚Äôd also recommend downloading other apps as well because, of course, Bumble isn‚Äôt the only dating app out there. 

Good luck finding your person!
title: Could be better, but also could be worse

developerResponse: {'id': 30241043, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-06-08T12:59:53Z'}
review: I love bumble BFF but I would say that the dating mode is geared toward women who like to be in the driving seat, the more aggressive types. I have found a lot of men who date on bumble a little entitled passive lazy mamas boys and are used to dating women who do all the work. They typically enjoy the female attention.  (The dating mode puts women in the driving seat where they have to be the one to pursue and initiate conversation with men). I am old fashioned and have feminine energy rather than masculine so I don‚Äôt feel comfortable approaching men I might like and am used to being pursued, and the man doing all the work. So if you are that type of woman, bumble date may not be for you. If you‚Äôre a feminine type woman, you may prefer an app like hinge, where men pursue you and you have the option to decline any advances if you do wish. You also have the option on hinge to pursue men if you wish but there is more mutuality there than Bumble date.
title: Interesting Dynamic

developerResponse: {'id': 26969863, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2021-12-21T11:45:50Z'}
review: It appears the devs have made advanced filters a premium option in order to compete with other dating apps. However, this makes no sense at all given that swiping left/rejecting people actually counts toward your daily swipe limit. As a straight guy who is 5‚Äô5‚Äù and resides in California, 70% of the women I see on this app are at least 5‚Äô7‚Äù or above. For the most part, women are completely uninterested in dating guys shorter than them. Heck, I know girls who are 5‚Äô2‚Äù that won‚Äôt settle for a guy unless they are at least 6‚Äô (which is honestly probably 5‚Äô10‚Äù, but still I‚Äôm way shorter than that). Thus, I feel it is UNJUST that Bumble forces me to waste swipes on girls who are taller than me whereas this would not be an issue for tall guys. This action to remove the advanced filters as a free option (at least the one for height) is borderline discrimination and is something that Bumble devs will not understand unless they talk to other short guys. I hope Bumble is willing to reconsider this decision so that short guys like me no longer feel discriminated against. Thank you.
title: Bring back Advanced Filters, or at least the filter for height

developerResponse: {'id': 25324661, 'body': "Hi there, thank you so much for giving us this feedback, and we'll be sure to pass it on to our Product Team so we can continue to improve the app. In the meantime our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport) so we can get you back up and buzzin'.", 'modified': '2021-09-26T15:09:18Z'}
review:
Pros: 

-Easy to use

-I like the layout of the profiles, the ability to add 3 answered questions (profile prompts), COVID preferences are easy to see

-One customer service inquiry was answered in a timely fashion (direct via FB messenger)

-Weekly subscription option that not all services offer 

-Several other nice little options, like the ability to expand your search by 2 miles (should be able to choose 5mi IMO)

Cons: 

-There‚Äôs an apparent issue that happens when you‚Äôre viewing/reading a profile, it randomly and inexplicably changes to a different profile without warning. Sometimes you don‚Äôt see that other profile again. Happens with potential matches also, and the like can disappear as if you swiped left (happened to me, missed that match). This means the app is pretty much making it so you can‚Äôt potentially match with people, which is rather counterproductive. 

-Can‚Äôt reset & view profiles that were already seen, only the last 3 viewed and only if you have the right sub; much like Tinder

-Can‚Äôt delete profile prompts (questions) once one is used

-Premium is pricy for the current state of the app but to be fair I think they‚Äôre all a bit overpriced

-No adding custom interests, prompts etc 

All in all... I‚Äôd definitely rank it above Tinder, but it‚Äôs not as wide sweeping as other services. There is definite need for improvement, particularly in functionality/stability.
title: Not too bad.. if it‚Äôll show you profiles long enough

developerResponse: {'id': 24914033, 'body': "Hi there, we really appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. Your safety is our number one priority and we are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app, so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-09-05T08:48:25Z'}
review:
I just started using Bumble again (I tried it briefly once before,) and I cannot figure out a way to hide my location! Are you guys insane!? It's one thing to give the information, "She's 10 miles away." It's a whole other thing to tell anyone and everyone where I am, where I live. I really do enjoy the app otherwise, and I've paid for the premium, but I don't know how often I can use it. I really feel unsafe. This is supposed to be the "safer" choice, but it isn't. For the sake of someone else's convenience, I'm giving up personal information and photographs about myself. No! Collect my data, but give me the option of exposing my location. This morning I read an article that someone collected a $2k bounty for finding EXACT locations for your app and see? There you go. Right there. Stalker City.

Five stars if you fix that one super weird choice.
title: Huge Security Risk

review: This isn‚Äôt on all but this has to be one of the worse dating apps out there and it seems it‚Äôs more fitted on finding people to hang out or just want to get into your pants, not marriage or an actual relationship. Not only you have to pay nearly freakin so much just to see your likes and all, the whole entire app itself is just ridiculous. Women are supposed to reach out and when we do, matches don‚Äôt respond or expect something else aside from what they put in their bios.  On top of that most of the guys on these apps are just straight up rude and egotistical, they don‚Äôt care about your feelings at all. I thankfully met at least some decent people, where I can hang out and be friends and acquaintances, even potentially a partner. But outside of that, it‚Äôs just not the best experience with coming back each time. As others mentioned you‚Äôre better off saving the money and going on an actual date and meet a genuine guy in person rather than invest then waste you‚Äôre time and money if you haven‚Äôt had any luck.
title: Done for good

review: Terrible app, other apps offer way better features without a premium. It‚Äôs so glaringly obvious where the app pushes for sales. I stopped getting matches after a week, I‚Äôm assuming my profile is showed and then shadowed away from users in order to force me to pay for a spotlight. It‚Äôs silly to have to pay just to be shown. Then I was left with the likes I could not see. So as an experiment I swiped left just to see how long it would take to have them shown in the deck. I probably swiped on hundreds of girls and my likes weren‚Äôt shown, another obvious attempt to force me to pay. I live near a major city but do I really have to go through hundreds of hundreds of girls just to have one of my likes be shown to me (they weren‚Äôt ever shown, I stopped after a few days of swiping left never getting the message ‚Äúyou missed a potential match‚Äù)? It‚Äôs a terrible app who‚Äôs goal isn‚Äôt to help you date. It‚Äôs to get you hooked and to pay only to fall off again and so you pay more in a cycle. If you did get a relationship out of the app they would  no longer have access to your wallet.
title: Shady app

developerResponse: {'id': 21956606, 'body': "For the safety of our users, we can never provide any details about why a user was blocked. However, if you feel you have been blocked incorrectly, we're always happy to take a second look at what's occurred. DM us on Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport) anytime.", 'modified': '2021-03-30T19:52:42Z'}
review: ABSOLUTELY DO NOT RECOMMEND! The app is garbage. I used it to make friends and improve my mental health. I opened the app one day and I was logged out. I tried to log in and it told me I was permanently blocked from the app. I read over all the guidelines trying to figure out what I possibly could have violated. I did not violate a single thing. I never argued with anyone on the app. I never had a bad conversation. I never sent or received pictures. I never advertised anything. I never even spoke politics. I emailed the company asking to know what complaint was filed against me. They promised ‚Äúno automated responses‚Äù and I received an automated response just saying I‚Äôm permanently blocked. I responded asking just to know what I violated and they sent me another automated response. I am honestly just hurt by this. I only used the app because I thought it would help improve my mental health and instead I‚Äôm left feeling even more depressed. I have lost contact with many friends I was chatting with on the app now and I don‚Äôt believe there is any way I can get back in contact with them. This app and the entire company are a disappointment.
title: I wish I could give negative stars.

developerResponse: {'id': 29621478, 'body': 'Hi WesleyG92. Currently, users can only match with those of the same gender on Bumble BFF but we totally hear you and we‚Äôll be sharing your feedback with our Product Team to advocate for this update in the future. Thanks for taking the time to let us know this is important to you. üíõ', 'modified': '2022-05-08T15:43:26Z'}
review:
Bumble BFF inherently recognizes that people need to make friends, new friends. This is especially crucial when for example you move or enter a period of new growth. And BFF inherently recognizes that people sometimes are solely looking for friends where sex can never be an option and harassment is a nonstarter, hence it limits matches only to the same gender. That only works for heterosexual people, and there is no way to change that setting. Cis-identifying queer people have no way of seeking platonic friendships safe from the risk of harassment or sexual pressure. And the utilization of the binary completely removes choice and sense of belonging for trans and non-binary folx for whom harassment and sexual pressure are never off the table anyways.

In short, why is the platonic side of this app geared first and foremost with cis-hets in mind, with virtually no liberty for queer people? Do we not deserve friends of our own choosing? Are we inherently incapable of making lasting and deep friendships with others of different gender identities?? Bumble BFF answers the latter two questions with a resounding YES. Shameful.
title: Bumble BFF is Homophobic

review: I really like that women have to make the first move. However you want to look at it they ultimately own the decision on if there will be any first contact. There are two important downsides though. First a lot of women just put their insta names in their profile. This gave me the impression that they‚Äôre lazy and have no sincere interest to engage via the app. They will just wait for men to inundate their insta with messages and make decisions based on your insta life. If you don‚Äôt have a fabulous an well manicured life on insta then you‚Äôre screwed. The second issue is a majority of women will never actually message you or they will just abruptly cancel the match. This gave me the impression that most users just swipe fast through their daily limit and only bother to review profiles if there is a match. If you want to get your money‚Äôs worth perhaps drop $20 with a bottle of scotch and play the odds, swipe fast through a thousand women in one night and take it from there.
title: Great concept but with downsides

developerResponse: {'id': 39921626, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2023-11-03T20:45:49Z'}
review:
Charged me for a week subscription.. even though I canceled my membership the week before. I tried contacting them and got ignored all 3 times I tried emailing them. Put my account into overdraft and paid over 100 in fees for a 32 charge. Companies horrible, customer service is non existent and don‚Äôt let them fool you. No one‚Äôs paying for membership so you‚Äôll never get matched because with non members you can‚Äôt read emails sent to you amongst a few other things. Most of the time good reviews come from the app owner. Do your homework first. You have been warned

*update* so I tried contacting these people for 2 weeks with no response. I had to dispute the charge with my card company and they ended up keeping the 125 in overdraft charges but refunding the 32 after bumble charged me for a week clearly after I canceled my membership a week before. The app is horrible. You will NEVER find a match and if you do the member dosnt want to pay the steep pricing so you will never hear from that match. Apple really needs to crack down on these apps that pray on people and there money.

developerResponse: {'id': 39508123, 'body': "We're always working to increase the number of genuine, quality connections for our users. Part of that means encouraging more intentional swiping. We incorporated a swipe limit to help our users get the results they‚Äôre hoping for. If you're in a rush to see more users though, you're always welcome to upgrade your account to Boost or Premium.", 'modified': '2023-10-14T08:22:57Z'}
review:
A few different things‚Ä¶ A) the swipe limit is ridiculous. I already know you‚Äôre going to say something about ‚Äúgenuine connections‚Äù but 10 likes a day is not going to work, especially when I live in a 1m+ populated city. And sometimes it takes extra long to get more likes when waiting. Maybe instead of like limit you do a match limit? B) the prices are outrageous and not worth it in any sense. How can you justify those prices? What is actually being paid for? Don‚Äôt answer that, I wouldn‚Äôt pay for any extra features on this app, why would I when the base model of other dating apps have more features and have better results than bumble does even after making a purchase. C) it‚Äôs also just finicky, liking people I don‚Äôt like. Disliking people I definitely would‚Äôve liked. And then no way to fix it without burning a hole in your wallet. I‚Äôll get notifications that someone matched with me, but when I go to check it‚Äôs as if it never happened. 

Just a few things I notice every time I‚Äôm on the app, I‚Äôll be deleting it now.
title: Not the best of apps

Which is super convenient given the fact that you have 24 hours to respond to a match‚Äôs message before you are unmatched from them. Quite a catastrophic flaw when it‚Äôs physically impossible to communicate with your matches on a dating app. I followed the instructions on bumble‚Äôs website that is supposed to solve any technical issues. This solved absolutely nothing so I contacted their support team. Their response was to link me to the very same instructions listed on their website. So all in all this app has a fatal flaw that makes it completely useless, and support has shown no urgency to help resolve the issue with their only response being to follow the instructions already listed on their website. review: I‚Äôve used this app and never paid for it, and didn‚Äôt like the results because they limit you on everything. So I said let‚Äôs give a try and paid for 1 month‚Ä¶ all of a sudden all these profile opened up. Got lots of likes and a got lots of ‚Äúhi‚Äù and never and thing said after that‚Ä¶ after my experiences on this app‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve come to this conclusion. The app is full of lots of fake accts. I feel that this company has algorithms that will give you likes and will open with hi to make you feel like you‚Äôre getting some activity. Once you really start using the app, all of a sudden there is never anyone in the local area. Everyone is always 20-30 miles a way and I live in a very populated city in Florida. I find this to be suspect. That‚Äôs not to that there are real people on here‚Ä¶ but there are more fake profiles then real and the distance feature on the filter does nothing cause it‚Äôs either no one in the area(live in large city) or they only show people that live no where around you‚Ä¶ enjoy the free app just don‚Äôt pay for anything!!
title: 2 thumbs down  do not waste time or money

developerResponse: {'id': 30054213, 'body': "Hi DoogieWayne. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. While this is the way our app works now, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-05-30T14:28:47Z'}
review:
This app has some ups and downs. Biggest complaint is the swipe reset timer. Rather than resetting at a set time (i.e. midnight), you have to wait a full 24 hours from the time you ran out of swipes until you can resume. The fact that this hasn‚Äôt been addressed tells me it‚Äôs deliberate so that users are inconvenienced into paying for an upgrade.

The women choose format is kind of refreshing but it seems like a lot of women either don‚Äôt know how the app works, are too timid to actually ‚Äúmake the first move‚Äù (a.k.a. literally type/send one letter or more to enable a conversation) or just swiped for kicks thinking it wouldn‚Äôt actually match. So, as refreshing as the different approach may be, it leaves a bit to be desired in practice.

There a decent amount of active users in most areas, which is essential. Unfortunately, you have to pay to see if anyone is interested. That might not be so bad if it was a reasonable price but $30/mo  to find out a bunch of people you weren‚Äôt interested in liked you is a total ripoff.

Overall, I‚Äôd recommend Hinge over Bumble or Tinder. Other services claim to care about your experience but monetize the crap out of critical features. Hinge, on the other hand, gives you all of that stuff for free. Yes, you read that correctly; they don‚Äôt make you pay to see who ‚Äúlikes you‚Äù. There may not be as many users but matching is far more effective.

Do better Bumble. ‚úåüèº
title: Honest review

review:
Though my time on the dating app scene was short lived and had its ups and downs, I owe a debt of gratitude to Bumble. 

Two months was all it took. 

One day I matched with this cute, green-eyed boy and we immediately clicked. It felt like reconnecting with an old friend from the very first messages we sent. We had our first date the following day because I was leaving on an international trip and had limited time to meet this guy. My ‚Äúeasy out‚Äù plan was happy hour at a brew house right across the street from my night job. I figured I could escape if things didn‚Äôt go well. Our 2pm-4pm date lasted until 7pm when I finally had to sprint to work, 30 min late ü§£

I flew to Italy with my mom the following day and immediately texted him a pic of the Roman Forum so he‚Äôd know I wasn‚Äôt just pretending to travel to get rid of him. We texted the whole two weeks and I made a cheesy wish at the Trevi Fountain right before mom and I left to come back home. 

A little over one year later my green-eyed guy and I went to Italy together and he proposed to me in front of the Trevi Fountain. I‚Äôm not the kind of girl that cheesy rom-com things happen to except for this one instance. Thank God for Bumble.

Nearly four years after I swiped right we are happily married with a baby on the way. 

I was always afraid of online dating. I am so so so happy I took the plunge.
title: Bumble Changed My Life

developerResponse: {'id': 27955540, 'body': "Thanks for taking the time to share your candid feedback. We understand the changes and testing with recent features have caused some significant changes to our members' experiences. We'll share all of this with our Product Team. If you'd like to chat more, feel free to message us at: bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2022-02-10T01:17:22Z'}
review:
As a dating service you would think a company would want to make sure their users felt they could trust the platform they on. But I guess Bumble‚Äôs priorities are more in getting money from people than providing a good customer experience. 

Taking away features without any warning at all and the only way you find out is when you start getting matched with people that are outside of what you‚Äôre comfortable with sounds so bizarre to me. Especially from a company that uses the platform of making it feel safer for women. 

Bumble changed the game and I guess hoped we wouldn‚Äôt notice. Then they go on to try to charge you almost $18 a month to get those features back!!!!!! Why would I give that much money to a company that obviously doesn‚Äôt care about their customers. What would be the benefit in me now paying for something I was told was free up until a couple weeks ago. Sad. And not worth the subscription. Time to move on to better dating platforms that care about their customers needs and feelings of security.
title: Focused more on profit than customer trust.

developerResponse: {'id': 37988451, 'body': "We're sorry to hear this. All of our core features are free to use. You don't have to pay to swipe, make matches, or send messages. We offer a few paid options to access additional features, but they're totally optional. You don't have to pay to make authentic connections in the Hive. If you have any questions, definitely reach out to our Support Team at bumble.com/contact", 'modified': '2023-07-31T05:25:22Z'}
review: I do like bumble. I really want to like it. And I would like to use it over a lot of the other apps out there. But they have a massive paywall to get over to get the best features. About a year ago, you had at least 15-20 likes for free. And that was enough to have a chance at a match, and enough to make you want to pay for more if you didn‚Äôt get it. Fast forward to the present, and our most recent update has given us at most 10 likes and at least 5 likes for free‚Ä¶ And then gives you the option to pay $15-$20 a week to have ‚Äúunlimited likes‚Äù.  I just don‚Äôt understand how you want/need engagement with users but you force them to pay an insane amount of money for what you are offering them to engage with. Basically I‚Äôm saying you messed up with this update and if you don‚Äôt revert the changes to the free like count you will lose a lot of free male users. Sorry for the unintelligible rant. Thank you to anyone that read this far.
title: Great Idea, Feels different, Works Well. BUT there is a pay wall

developerResponse: {'id': 27514566, 'body': "We really appreciate your feedback, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team. If not, you can still quickly review each users' info badges with a quick scroll before you swipe.", 'modified': '2022-01-18T14:06:41Z'}
review:
As a black woman who prefers dating black or other ethnic man, it‚Äôs already hard because there‚Äôs no option to search for that. Bumble thinks that ignoring race somehow solves racism. LET THE PEOPLE HAVE WHAT THEY WANT. I am literally swiping through 20 men at a time to find ONE ethnic one. So it‚Äôs already taking extremely long. 

Then, as of yesterday Bumble removed the 2 free filters and now charge a steep $40 a month to be able to filter your search. For example, I‚Äôm looking for men who want to be in a relationship but I have to swipe through a sea of guys who are looking for casual hookups and ‚Äúdon‚Äôt know yet‚Äù. So now it takes 75 swipes to find an ethnic man, who is also looking for a relationship. And let‚Äôs hope we‚Äôre both attracted to each other, share similar political views, and other qualifiers. It‚Äôs NOT WORTH IT ANYMORE. The time it takes to sift because the developers want to squeeze every penny they can is not worth it. Choose from the dozens of other apps. I‚Äôve muted my profile, deleted the app, and moved on to another app.
title: Search filters are no longer free, swiping is unbearable

review: Created a profile and started swiping. Had a few conversations going and everything was smooth. Did my swipes for the next day then continued my conversations. Woke up the next morning to being blocked from the app for ‚Äúinappropriate or abusive behavior‚Äù. So used a little logic and created a new profile and started over. This time did my swipes and got one and I mean ONE conversation started. Kept it very very casual. Wake up the next morning and boom blocked again. What happens is if someone really doesn‚Äôt want to talk to you they get the option to unmatch you and provide a reason. One of the reasons provided, without needing to talk to the person, is ‚Äúinappropriate or abusive behavior‚Äù. I literally was talking to one person and was having a good convo so I know it didn‚Äôt come from that person. Only explanation would be I guess I swiped right on some people out there that are but hurt they can‚Äôt get a good match üòÇ but instead of using their free time to go to a different site they choose to spend it on Bumble to burn peoples accounts. Fix this. It is not ok.
title: Broken concept

review: I like that women make the first move for comfort reasons, I don‚Äôt love the swiping in general as I‚Äôve accidentally swiped the wrong direction a few times. I don‚Äôt like that I don‚Äôt get ‚Äúpotential matches‚Äù in a separate stack from other matches where I consciously know ‚Äúokay these dudes like me I should pay closer attention‚Äù. I hate that I don‚Äôt get like at least one free undo press a day like Hinge. I don‚Äôt like that I can‚Äôt even LOOK at guys who liked me one at a time (like on Hinge) without paying money. I‚Äôm a broke college grad, I can‚Äôt afford the Starbucks I buy lol. I prefer Hinge to Bumble but prefer Bumble‚Äôs ladies first mentality. OH and the filters on Bumble don‚Äôt work. I shouldn‚Äôt be seeing other religions if I put Christian as a dealbreaker. And if I put ‚Äúseeking men‚Äù I shouldn‚Äôt be getting ‚Äúthey/them‚Äù people. I wish you could filter by pronouns in that case so at least there‚Äôs a 50/50 shot it‚Äôs a cis-male I‚Äôm talking to. I love everyone as a friend but dating wise, I‚Äôm traditional.
title: Decent but not great.

review:
The only reason I give 2 instead of 1 is because I‚Äôve used Bumble on and off since like 2017 and can count on one hand the couple connections made.
I have tried to reach out on numerous occasions to better understand why my account feels blocked but I‚Äôve received no answer from Customer service. 
I have paid and trialed here and there in the past and I just paid for a month now FEB 2022. The probability of me not even making one match with relation to the amount that I have swiped (in this month and even altogether) makes absolutely ZERO sense. I look good and have a nice profile- but that doesn‚Äôt even matter in this case. I‚Äôve seen people and friends with weak profiles make way more connections. 2 random individuals came up in my ‚Äúbeeline‚Äù Within the month- no action besides that and the SAME day my Month ended, I got 2 women in my beeline that I couldn‚Äôt see üòÇ greedy and awful 

Every dating app has its flaws, but look elsewhere. Go to hinge or Feeld.
title: Horrible; controlled algorithm & awful customer service

title: Account start up

developerResponse: {'id': 38660366, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2023-09-01T09:39:43Z'}
review: So I‚Äôve used a few dating apps and I really like bumble. It‚Äôs easy to use. So easy. I don‚Äôt have to pay for messaging. It freaked me out a bit when I learned the women have to message first because I have anxiety. üòÖ however it‚Äôs not like complicated and there‚Äôs prompts if I have no idea how to message first. I wish there was an option as to where I could save profiles I‚Äôm not sure about but don‚Äôt want to decline. I feel like that could be a real game changer because I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs any dating app that has a feature like that. I‚Äôve never paid for a premium membership and really don‚Äôt hope to one day but so far on bumble I‚Äôve had a few matches. The speed dating is really nice too. developerResponse: {'id': 34902101, 'body': "On Bumble we empower women to make the first move in their relationships to shift old-fashioned power dynamics and encourage equality from the start. If you have any other suggestions feel free to contact our team at bumble.com/contact.", 'modified': '2023-02-16T09:11:43Z'}
review: When this app first came out, it was different and a welcome change. Being a guy it was sort of nice to see that the ladies would make the first move if they were interested. Having said that, there is no real incentive for men to use this app period! First are the ‚Äúfree swipes‚Äù, they used to be unlimited but now limit you to maybe 10-12 per 24hr period unless you‚Äôre willing to pay. Secondly, the price for this app makes no sense for men to pay for. It is already set up so men cannot contact women first and now they want you to pay $40+ a month for what, to look at pictures?!? Last but not least, women do not traditionally reach out first when it comes to dating, so even if she were interested, she‚Äôs not going to make first contact so this app is counterintuitive. Being of the male half of this equation, there are better apps for the money. All you get is a picture of you pay, you can‚Äôt message and there is no guarantee that the women will even respond if you do swipe right, so why are you paying for???
title: No real incentive for guys to use this app

title: Frustrating to Use (Update)

Send our Support Team a message via Facebook or Twitter (@bumblesupport) anytime for help.", 'modified': '2021-05-25T18:37:53Z'}
review: Bumble used to be my favorite dating app by far. It‚Äôs layout was intuitive and it‚Äôs features were extensive. Most importantly, though, it‚Äôs recommendation algorithm was straightforward and geared towards getting users matches as quick as possible. I am not particularly deluged by likes on the app, but when I did have likes, those who liked me appeared at the beginning of the feed before anyone else. This was in stark contrast to tinder, where you can have many likes and have little idea where they will show up in your feed. Now, bumble is worse than tinder in this regard. I recently redownloaded and got around 20 likes in the first 48 hours or so but was only shown maybe 5 of them. This was far worse than tinder, which I recently redownloded as well. I‚Äôm very disappointed with bumbles decision to jump on the bandwagon and gone against its ethos of being the more ethical, user conscious app. This decision may make bumble more profitable, but it will come at the cost of user wellbeingüòî
title: Recent update takes bumble from being one the best dating apps to one of the worst

developerResponse: {'id': 25196243, 'body': 'Congratulations! We‚Äôre so happy to hear that you‚Äôve met your special bee on Bumble. We‚Äôd love to hear more about your story at http://bumble.com/stories.üíõ', 'modified': '2021-09-20T04:45:17Z'}
review: Let me start off by saying that I matched with my now husband on the day I downloaded the app. I am born and raised in a small town and my hopes of finding love were very limited. I deleted the app the following day, since I didn‚Äôt think a dating app fit my search for love, at the time we had already exchanged numbers. It‚Äôs been a little over a year now, and we have been married for a month. Bumble matched us so well. It did help that both of us knew what we were looking for. What‚Äôs even crazier is that we only lived a mile from each other. This review almost sounds fake even to me, but it happened. We are so in love and so perfect for each other. We‚Äôve talked about writing a review for this app because we‚Äôre just so grateful we signed up for it. Thank you Bumble and to the experts that make this happen.
title: Thank you Bumble!

developerResponse: {'id': 22222787, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2021-04-13T16:59:47Z'}
review:
Gives you 1 million genders to choose from then proceeds to make you choose the man or woman section so you can only be matched with people who chose the same in BFF mode. Weird. There‚Äôs a lot to unpack there. But mainly, why they think you shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to be friends with the opposite sex? I‚Äôm not sure. Users should be able to toggle that themselves. 

Matches expire in 24 hours if you don‚Äôt message. I doubt this will ever change since it makes you open the app more often so that‚Äôs obviously beneficial to the company. It‚Äôs very annoying though. I don‚Äôt want to have to check the app every day and I didn‚Äôt, so I always was losing matches. Big reason I stopped using this 

Women are required to message first when matching with men in the dating mode. Yeah I get it, guys usually message first, but, they‚Äôve never been required to. It seems they think it‚Äôs some sort of activism breaking gender norms, but all that does is reverse it. Not getting the goal there. This feature is similar to the being forced to only make friends with the same-sex feature. This along with my next critique ruined the dating mode for me

Firstly, I‚Äôm bi. Bumble is surprisingly not queer friendly. It seems like it would be, since it gives you 1 million gender options, but if you‚Äôre searching for same-gender matches in the dating section, it shows you people from the friends section also, who are evidently looking for friends, not dates. Very weird and again, annoying.
title: Great concept, annoying to use

developerResponse: {'id': 38183319, 'body': "Oh no! Our Support Team would be more than happy to help assist you with verifying your profile. Send us a quick message at bumble.com/contact and we'll get you up and buzzin' in no time!", 'modified': '2023-08-09T06:52:13Z'}
review:
Used to have it years ago, just recently got it again. 

First off, it‚Äôs the only app like this that you can‚Äôt upload landscape pictures. Like if it was normal it would have a couple black bars but be ok. Instead they think it‚Äôs a good idea to zoom in on your face and make you look like a creep. May not seem like a huge issue but when you‚Äôve taken the best picture of your life and would like to use it, it‚Äôs an issue. I actually had to pay someone a few bucks to reorient my image to portrait without distorting it in a photo editor. 

Secondly, you‚Äôre allowed almost 0 swipes. I swiped right on 5 people and ran out within 90 seconds and now have to wait another 24 hours. Instead of gaining revenue in some useful ways like advertisements, they think you‚Äôre going to pay a ridiculous amount for almost nothing. Bumble used to be a really good app. I suppose they‚Äôd rather try to milk a few people dry than gain money from everyone. Can‚Äôt imagine how much longer they‚Äôll be in business with this sort of model
title: Bumble has gone down hill

developerResponse: {'id': 32018618, 'body': "This doesn‚Äôt sound ideal and we'd love to take a closer look at this! Can you please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-09-14T14:24:56Z'}
review: I have enjoyed using bumble for bff! In reality I‚Äôve only met one lasting friend on here but I do see the potential and one is better than none!! Here‚Äôs the issue I paid for premium once and their pricing systems were soo screwy! They were running a promo so I couldn‚Äôt find any of the lesser options... Ended up choosing boost to undo a skip.. then after that got advertised what premium was (was more than the promo I had been advertised all morning lol..?) and that it was only $12 more than boost. so I said fine I‚Äôll do it for a week.. ended up getting charged for both! I thought it was only $12 more since it was a promo advertised RIGHT after getting boost AND bc it said ‚Äúonly $12 more‚Ä¶‚Äù I think you could really improve the subscription options and clearly state them somewhere instead of having to dig through :( it was disappointing to see I was double charged too based on the messaging in the app. Was really confusing.
title: Good! But..

developerResponse: {'id': 27804084, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-02-02T11:46:19Z'}
review: I have used Bumble for a few years now and even though I haven‚Äôt found a match, I like the little reminders when I don‚Äôt check in after a few days. I really like that you can confirm in real time using pictures that the person your talking to matches there pictures and are not a cat fish (the blue shield). I also like and don‚Äôt mind the tracking of my location and find it very helpful when seeing other matches locations to know about how many miles away they are from me ( especially when I don‚Äôt recognize some smaller towns or county‚Äôs). I do think that part of the app needs an update because my home location isn‚Äôt listed as an option and it doesn‚Äôt differentiate between different county‚Äôs very well ( like my locations of Summerfield, Belleview, Ocala or Wildwood FL).
title: Bumble location tracking

review: I have serious issues with the amount of money that this app charges, $29 a week to be able to make use of the app is honestly ridiculous to me. You're almost paying $120 a month, just to try and meet new people. Else you have to spend most of your day just swiping through matches, hoping you find someone that has already liked you. When trying to see who's liked you, when you are using voiceover on the iPhone, you have to turn off voiceover, tap randomly around the screen and hope that you click on the profile, then turn voiceover back on to read it. there is a lot of work that goes into using this app when you are blind. Unfortunately because of that, I will not be renewing my subscription. When I attempted to review my profile after canceling my subscription to make changes, all that I was able to see was a page telling me that I should renew my subscription. I was not able to exit, and I was not able to see my profile.
title: Rather inaccessible for people using voiceover on the iPhone.

review: I have been wanting to write this review for a while. I downloaded the bumble app a couple of years ago back in 2019, and on the second day after downloading it, I met the love of my life. I never thought I would be writing a positive review for a dating app but this app really changed my life.
