The only thing i would change is the 24 hour period to respond.  Thank you Bumble
title: I found love

review:
This app could be very good, but I refuse to use it because it requires you to display your current location to EVERYONE at all times in order to even use the app. Seriously??? What century are the developers living in??? This is beyond a HUGE safety issue. I‚Äôve had enough online dating stalkers over the years, the last thing I want to do is show my current location to people I don‚Äôt even know. Several times I‚Äôve begun chatting with a match, just to have them question why I‚Äôm currently in a different part of town than I live‚Ä¶.umm, no thanks!! I can‚Äôt believe they haven‚Äôt been sued over this major safety issue. Or maybe they have and just don‚Äôt care. 
There is absolutely NO benefit from giving everyone your current location, only potential problems. I urge everyone to think long and hard before signing up on here. Developers, get a clue and get in the 21st century. The world is dangerous enough without a bunch of strangers knowing where you are at all times  And people get possessively weird when it comes to dating.
title: üö©üö©üö©MAJOR SAFETY WARNING!!!üö©üö©üö©

developerResponse: {'id': 26196637, 'body': "Our team is continually working to improve our platform, and we're so thankful for your feedback. We will pass it along to our Product Team to consider for future updates. If you ever have any questions or additional feedback, feel free to contact us directly via Facebook or Twitter (@BumbleSupport)‚Äîwe're here for you!", 'modified': '2021-11-10T15:30:29Z'}
review:
You are *REQUIRED* to profess your support for one of 3 women‚Äôs rights issues on the app. It is impossible to continue using it without saying you support 1 of 3 causes they force you to support, whether or not you do. I obviously care about women‚Äôs rights and equality, but I don‚Äôt see these issues the same way the Bumble team does. They give you various profile options to show your support for progressive social causes. I can say I support Black Lives Matter, or Stop Asian Hate, etc. but I can‚Äôt say I support privacy, guns, lower taxes, small government, etc. You can say you‚Äôre ‚Äúout and proud!!!‚Äù, but can‚Äôt just say for example that you happen to be bisexual. It‚Äôs truly not an inclusive place. You can say you‚Äôre ‚Äúconservative, liberal, or moderate‚Äù but not green or libertarian, etc. (which are neither). Either you‚Äôre part of the progressive woke mob, or you‚Äôre not welcome on bumble. Let people express themselves, even if you disagree with their ideology.

Additionally, privacy is abysmal, requiring location to be on at all times.
title: Forces You to Adopt Bumble Team‚Äôs Activist Causes and Moral Positions

review: This app is worthless. If you're a male, Bumble hides all of your likes so that you're forced to pay 17 dollars or more just to see them. On top of that, Bumble recycles all of the same profiles so it doesn't matter if you swipe left or right or if you're a paying member, those profiles will eventually cycle thru your feed again so that you're only swiping on new people less than 50% of the time. I'm also sick and tired of swiping on people that live nowhere near my state even with my location turned on. Connecticut, the Yukon, California, New York and Boston are NOWHERE near me, but no matter what I set my radius to (always between 10-25 miles) all I get is out of staters with a few locals peppered in. The absolute worst part of Bumble is that they do nothing to ban anti-vaxxers or white supremacists. Seriously, there are tons of women on Bumble that use their profile to go on ignorant diatribes about politics and vaccines and Bumble has done nothing to stop them. I've already wasted enough money on this poor excuse of a dating app, don't waste yours!
title: A Waste of Time and Money

I sent a message to bumble in ‚Äúcontact‚Äù section on the app about 2 weeks ago and I got a message that they‚Äôll be responding back to me via email and I have yet to receive a response from anyone. So, I just sent another message through the app and I‚Äôm still waiting on a response. I want a refund from what I paid last month OR a free month. review: I‚Äôve used bumble in the past with great success. Never paid anything and have found multiple dates back in time 2018.  I took a long break from online dating and finally decided to return. (I used the same pictures as in the past) It‚Äôs clear the only goal of this app now is to generate cash flow. It‚Äôs sad and irresponsible. I decided to pay $10 for a week of premium just to test things out after nearly a three+ year break. Only a handful of matches. As soon as my premium ran out I received 10x as many likes as when I had premium. It‚Äôs 100% a scam, they want you hooked and paying so they slowly trickle matches along the way. Another good example of the way algorithms ARE NOT CONSUMER FRIENDLY. This app and this company relies on you NOT finding love. The longer they can string you along the better for their profit margins. You can pay nothing but the app will rarely if ever serve you up a match. It‚Äôs rigged and my recent payments have confirmed my suspicions, old bumble was fantastic. The ‚Äúnew‚Äù and evolved bumble is against you.

The next day, I tried logging into the app, and it wouldn‚Äôt allow it, like I had been banned. I still had a month of premium left, but I never got to use it. review:
- it‚Äôs a money making scheme like all the rest. I think it‚Äôs designed to make you frustrated so that you‚Äôll pay their crazy overpriced subscription fees. Maybe you realize you missed that they smoke cigarettes or don‚Äôt want kids or already have kids and it‚Äôs really frustrating. Oh unless you pay a buttload of money. review: After using this app several times, I was losing interest in it. Until I decided to use it one more time, the best decision I have ever made. I met a wonderful woman who completely changed my life. We were hundreds of miles away from one another, she had changed her location to my area and I‚Äôm so thankful that she did. We had great conversations, and then eventually began FaceTiming many nights, and finally we began traveling together to see one another. We had spent so much time together, and created many memories before we knew it! We are engaged now, and starting our lives together. Yes at first using this app felt like and endless inbox of boring conversations and connections that lead to nowhere, but you never know what could happen when you take another chance and end up meeting ‚Äúyour‚Äù person. developerResponse: {'id': 38376891, 'body': "We know that from time to time people can get busy or feel nervous starting a chat and this can be frustrating if you are really interested in the connection! That's why we give our members one free Extend per day in the hopes it will give those who need it a little more time to start the chat. You can learn more here: https://bit.ly/3llOnmI.", 'modified': '2023-08-18T09:09:43Z'}
review:
This app is great. It has one drawback though. When you match with someone, the girl has to respond first, though this is not inherently a bad thing, the girls just don‚Äôt start a conversation when we match. For example, I matched with someone and then I had to wait until they started the conversation. They didn‚Äôt start it ever so I extended the time they had to match with me, and they still didn‚Äôt start.

All in all great app. But this one feature (though good in concept) is not good in practice. If I were to suggest an improvement to this I would say to either nix the entire idea or make it such that the second person to like has to start the conversation (so if I liked someone and later they liked me, they would start the conversation. But if they liked me first and I liked their profile later then I would start the conversation.)

review: Dating as a 30+ working professional is rough, but dating apps should make it easier, correct? Well, sort of, for Bumble. I love the idea of an app where women get to message first, as they often are faced with a deluge of garbage of bad puns/jokes/explicit messages. Enter Bumble. Cool concept, but your matches only last for 24 hours. I get a lot of matches but a good majority of them expire, as what busy person checks the app every single day? Want to increase the time? Pay. Daily you get to swipe less than other online dating apps. Want more? Pay. And the prices? Hah. Might as well be paying a $40+ a month subscription or opt for the lifetime pass. Bumble is the only online dating app that I‚Äôve seen so far where it would be better for my wallet to buy random ladies drinks at the local bar than attempt to use the app to its fullest through a subscription. Anyway, this close to uninstalling this thing and just spending time on alternatives to Bumble. Which is too bad, really, as I like the idea of it.

Now for the low price of $8.99 a month you can get those back swipes back. They also set a limit on how many people you can swipe on a day, but have no fear because behind a paywall you can have unlimited swipes. I loved using bumble when I first moved because it gave me opportunities to meet someone while busy in my graduate program. I‚Äôm a broke student so I can‚Äôt justify the cost but Bumble used to be waaaay better before paywalling everything. Bumble tries justifying this by saying they want you to form ‚Äúmeaningful connections‚Äù but at $7.99/week just say you gotta make money.

Customer service people are nice and all, but you simply can‚Äôt get anyone to respond to you in a timely manner. They tell you ‚Äú48 hours‚Äù but it is not true. Not true at all. review:
I was initially drawn to this app, thinking that a service that allows women to message first would result in more in person interactions and dates. This was certainly not the case. Not only is the premium subscription way more expensive than other dating apps, but they nickel and dime you for any type of interaction with somebody‚Äôs profile. Other dating apps allow you to comment on somebody‚Äôs profile to increase interaction and personability . Bumble charges per comment which actively discourages interacting with somebody‚Äôs profile. I think this is a huge flaw and makes it no different than Tinder for how you interact with it. 

Additionally, I haven‚Äôt had trouble getting likes, matches, messages, and dates from people on other apps, but bumble was extremely disappointing.

I like and dislike the ability to set filters for who I see. But personally, if you are allowing height to be a filtered, I think BMI should also be a category as well..
title: Disappointing

review:
Every single top pick is a liberal. I barely see conservatives anymore - used to see them pretty equally to moderate and liberal. I left swipe on every liberal (with very few exceptions) so you‚Äôd think the algorithm would pick up on that. I have a feeling that this is not an accident.

Also, why the devs haven‚Äôt put in transgender men and transgender women in their own category and made it a ToS violation to not be honest in your profile about things like your sex and gender has been a major question for years now. This can only help the trans community by showing them and showing them TO people whom are interested in that and open to dating them. At this point it seems like a propaganda push to not have already done this.

The concept and functionality of features in place are flawless, and the UI/UX is pretty decent (would love a dark mode), which is the only reason why there is more than 1 star in this review.

The only thing this app does to try and differentiate is allow women to message first. A value proposition that doesn‚Äôt really provide any value? review:
So overall I get plenty of matches so that‚Äôs a plus. The women on the app seem to be a little more serious about meeting for a date than the other swipe app. It‚Äôs fun  like just looking at profiles some people are pretty funny. 

Now some problems I have with the app. There are quite a few profiles just promoting their IG account look for followers, if this was the only problem I could live with it. There are profiles that are obviously using their profile as a political platform and not a dating one. There are guys who are looking for gay encounters that show up even if I apply filters. 

That has more to do with the users and not the app itself but there are issues with the app too. The filter only lets you add what you are interested in rather than exclude something you don‚Äôt want. If I was able to check exclude ‚Äúgay, polyamorous, non monogamist, transgender ‚Äú so I don‚Äôt spend to much time look through stuff I‚Äôm not interested in at all. 

There is a left leaning culture in the app when it should be neutral, I‚Äôd prefer bumble not be political at all. If this was the app to empower women then it has lost it‚Äôs direction, because guys are able to keep there profiles as women, I find it disrespectful to women. Lastly I would overlook a lot of this if the subscription wasn‚Äôt so expensive.

So I had a mini existential crisis and tentatively selected non-binary and then gender questioning since that wasn‚Äôt an option under woman. Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-05-30T12:28:13Z'}
review:
According to the stats of early 2021, it was almost 70% of men and 30% women using this app in the us. Now it feels like it‚Äôs 90% to 10% at least in nyc. 
I decided to give this app another chance. First day I got 30 likes, the 2nd - 2, and then nothing. Out of 30 people there were mostly 4/10 girls (either obese or unattractive), who I didn‚Äôt feel like matching with. The only 2 girls who were around my level of attractiveness (7/10) didn‚Äôt want to match with me. 
At the same time my female friend (around 5/10) got 2400+ likes since February and 400+ matches. She goes out with guys who are 7/10 or even 8/10, who are by far more attractive than her. 
Is that fair? There‚Äôs more women than men in NYC. By at least 250k ppl. 
This app doesn‚Äôt care about guys at all. It spoils women by providing them an unfair advantage. Which consequently spoils their offline behavior. Why does a guy, who is 7/10 or 8/10 has to date some 5/10 girl? Why do we have to settle for unattractive girls?
title: This app hugely disadvantages men and makes them feel ugly

So that‚Äôs always a plus, unless you‚Äôre into that I guess. What put it at a 5 star for me was they actually have a section to guide people on dating and what to look out for for harassment and other unwanted/inappropriate behaviors by potential suitors, and it just makes the environment seem that much more comforting.  Of all the apps I‚Äôve used for dating, bumble is probably the most trusted for authentic connections in a comfortable atmosphere of the electronic world.

review: I swore I‚Äôd never get married again after divorce from my husband of 25 years. I am 50 and a professional woman‚Ä¶and just didn‚Äôt think I needed a man in my life.  But my kids (16,18) pushed me to start dating again and went to the trouble to add Bumble to my phone, set up my profile and swipe away. (They had a ball doing all of that!)   With much encouragement from my sons, I messaged three people and ultimately went on two dates.  I ended up meeting the love of my life on date #2!!! He lived in a city 600 miles from me‚Ä¶so we would otherwise have never met!  (He was in town visiting a family member when we connected on Bumble). We‚Äôve been together three years and got married recently.  He is truly the most special man and perfect for me in every way!!!  Thank you Bumble!!!!
title: Works!!!

review:
I think Bumble is a great app that does something rare which is putting the beginning of an interaction in the hands of the women which is great! 

But there are a few tiny things that could be done to make this app even better which in my eyes would warrant a 5/5 star. 

1. Please remove the feature of swiping left to right for replying to a message. This may be exclusive to iPhone users but I cannot count how many times i have tried to use the iPhone‚Äôs ‚Äúback‚Äù feature of swiping left to right like on every single other app to go to the previous page but I and prompted with the reply where I must cancel then hit the back arrow. Plus if you press and hold a message you already have reply amongst other things as and option.

2. Allow us to control when the 24hr countdown until unmatch begins. Alot of people do not have access to their phones every single day and or are able to check the app to see if you have matched. It would be great if the 24hr timer starts after you view the matched person‚Äôs profile. Because who knows you could match with youre true soulmate but didnt know it because your phone was broke or you were out camping or on a business trip without access to your phone ect.
title: Almost a great dating app

developerResponse: {'id': 37525384, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2023-07-07T02:27:22Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve never been more frustrated with a dating app. I don‚Äôt want to travel all over the country to meet a guy who happens to be at the airport or visiting someone who is currently close to me. I want to meet someone who LIVES local. But with this app, you have to scroll all the way down to the bottom of the guy‚Äôs profile to see where he actually lives. You‚Äôll also see where they are right now so you can hook up. This will be your local airport or the town next to yours. But they don‚Äôt live there! This is a huge mistake on an app that is supposed to be for women to make the first move in meeting a man. It needs to be re-labeled ‚Äúperfect app for a quick hook up‚Äù. 

You obviously don‚Äôt check anyone‚Äôs background. The last guy I was going to meet in person doesn‚Äôt even have a home. He lived in his truck three weeks out of the month, and hooked up with women from your site wherever he was in between runs. He was a homeless truck driver and you didn‚Äôt even know it.
title: Set up for hookups only!

If you have any questions, definitely reach out to our Support Team at bumble.com/contact", 'modified': '2023-03-07T08:55:28Z'}
review:
This app is designed to keep those who ‚Äúlike‚Äù you, hidden behind a paywall. You can swipe left or right forever, but those ‚Äúlikes‚Äù won‚Äôt show up in your feed. Instead, the algorithms will strategically give you one or two as a means to keep your hopes up and coming back for more, but never all. You must pay to see them. So, in a sense, Bumble is intentionally withholding matches until you pay. Not sure how this is even legal, as it‚Äôs equivalent to a rigged carnival game. 

The pervasiveness of apps like these are negatively impacting how people in our society today meet and engage, contributing to isolationism, mental health issues, and just plain old Darwinism. Until governments look closely at these deceptive online dating practices it will not change. 

The executives at companies like these should be investigated for fraud. If you work for a company like Bumble, how well you sleep at night is likely based on how much corporate kool-aid you‚Äôre drinking, your na√Øvet√©, and your annual salary. It takes a village to create a scam this big and deceptive only to turn a blind eye. 

Congrats guys and gals! You ARE changing the world!‚Ä¶For the worse. üòî

P.S. Not looking forward to the canned ‚ÄúDeveloper Response‚Äù that will try and convenience me and readers of how perfect their company is, and that in the end it‚Äôs really me (you), not them. 

Yeah, the fact that they actually have someone on the payroll as an app-review gaslighter is despicable. üòí
title: An Algorithmic Scam

review:
it‚Äôs a decent dating app, definitely a top 5, however it‚Äôs got some issues. 

UI: 
awful. it‚Äôs been clunky for years and nothing has changed. you‚Äôre required to scroll down to view profiles but the app sometimes reads a down scroll (no matter how careful you are) as a left or right swipe. and now all the sudden you‚Äôve matched without someone you didn‚Äôt want to and they‚Äôre messaging you and you feel bad. this isn‚Äôt even a once in a while thing, this happens all the time. 

time limits: i like the idea of having women make the first move. makes the app feel more safe i guess. less chance of weirdos and unwanted dms. however the limit is 24 hours and then if you haven‚Äôt reached out or vice versa (depending on who‚Äôs turn it is) then you loose the match unless you pay money to get it back. I just wish that it was like 48 hours at least or even 36. it‚Äôs definitely not uncommon for me to forget to check the app for a day. and then anything that may have happened during that time is gone. i think alternatively having the timer start once the other person opens the app would be fine. because if i match and they don‚Äôt open the app for 24hrs then it‚Äôs gone. 

otherwise a decent dating app. not complaints with anything else really. it‚Äôs just overdue for an update
title: fine

title: Only one con

review:
As the title says, I really did enjoy the app, made some fun little matches, but I can‚Äôt help but find myself having issues with how the premium subscription works. 

Based on the purchase I made for a week of premium I had soent 30 bucks ($30/week) The fact you can‚Äôt ACTUALLY match with someone, or even message them unless A: You have premium and you like someone who likes you back to match. Or B: You use your limited amount of free comments create a conversation. 

I do not like that only this premium subscription gives you the ability to really match with someone and kinda goes against the people who actually really enjoy the app as a dating source. I believe I should gain the ability to use the majority of this app without needing to pay a subscription fee, which can be reserved for the many other fun side qualities i cones with like being more noticable, etc. 

Having no ability to see who likes me gets me really beat down for not having the excessive funds that they require to see anyone, and the price is just not worth not being alone for the rest of my life. I hope that someday this can change, I can match with someone far easier than how this app does at this moment.
title: It‚Äôs a really fun app to use!

If you have any questions, definitely reach out to our Support Team at bumble.com/contact", 'modified': '2022-01-18T14:10:42Z'}
review: Even though I'm a woman I can clearly see how the devs try and make dating a pay-to-win with their app. There's inconsistency in the premium pricing between genders, making it way more expensive for men than women to have a good experience. You limit the swipes a day in ANY direction (iirc tinder only limits right swipes), and then you take away the 2 free filters and hiding them behind a paywall, so now I have to swipe through all of these people that just don't meet my personal requirements because you're trying to milk some more money out of your user base? If the filters were only available to paying users from the beginning it wouldn't even be an issue, but to have the 2 filters as an option for free users for YEARS and then take them away without a single word? Not even a tiny mention in the patch notes? Alrightly. I'd rather be stuck using my vibrator for the rest of my life than paying for your services.
title: Too expensive, and taking away all features worth using.

I‚Äôm very disappointed in this aspect of the app. It‚Äôs always bothered me because while it is one of the only apps to make platonic relationships, it does not allow you to be friends with the gender spectrum. This seems so closed minded for such an inclusive and seemingly progressive app. 
I‚Äôm already in a committed relationship and I want to make more friends. I get along with people all over the gender spectrum and it hurts me to see this app excluding so many diverse and interesting people from my friend scope. I deleted the app after getting frustrated by this. 
There‚Äôs many other flaws as well, but to me this one was glaringly obvious and I only saw one other review addressing the issue. I don‚Äôt think this app was intended to be exclusively for dating so neglecting a huge portion of the draw is disappointing.

review: Let me just say, there is absolutely no way I‚Äôd sock money into this app when you have a competitor that legitimately supports equality among all groups, and has a name more widely known than this one. Tinder lets you express yourself, and doesn‚Äôt feel the need to moderate accounts for random reasons, which I figure is kind of ridiculous. Why does a report button exist if you‚Äôre constantly surveilling accounts for every little thing? No bathroom selfies? What kind of rule is that? Bikini pics allowed outside, but you better be wearing a shirt in that pool if you‚Äôre a man? Nice double standard. You‚Äôve gotta pay for unlimited likes and travel mode, features that come with the free version of Tinder? Yea, right, decisions decisions, so many things going for this app that makes me want to keep it over going back to Tinder. Good luck running a successful dating app that favors one gender over another, you‚Äôre bound to have many success stories, at least from the LGBT community.

review:
Someone hacked into my account on this app and I guess made a new profile with my number and email address but as a complete different person. I have no idea why someone would do that or how that would benefit them. Who knows.
But I tried to login one day and saw all of this so I tried to email bumble support and their response was to lock ME out of my own account and then they said I could log back in when I took a selfie that verified I was the same person in those pictures. 
Obviously I WASNT because I don‚Äôt even know who that person was, and i emailed them saying this but never heard back. 
So someone else is in an account right now that still has my name, age, email and phone number, and bumble is locking ME out of accessing it even though I‚Äôve emailed them with that very email address. It‚Äôs crazy. 
I hope they took down all the pictures I had there because I don‚Äôt want some Bot doing weird activity and making it look like I act that way

developerResponse: {'id': 25604797, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us, Marlay. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team. If you have other suggestions or need help, please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to assist you.", 'modified': '2021-10-11T06:39:49Z'}
review:
Girlfriend convinced me to download Bumble to meet friends at the start of the COVID pandemic. I was reluctant at first and even upon first using the app, did not feel inclined to continue. But, after giving it a second shot, I‚Äôve been able to meet so many cool dudes in just a year while working from home. 

Apart from the success I‚Äôve found within the app, I‚Äôve never had any UI or bug issues. Everything is simple and straightforward. 

The only issue I‚Äôve had is accidental swiping. Now I understand this might be a tactic to get people to upgrade their subscription, but it is too easy to accidentally swipe left or right. There have been some cool people that I would‚Äôve loved to meet but I accidentally lost the connection by mis-swiping; for that, I give it 4 stars instead of 5.
title: Bumble BFF has been life changing

review:
Had several technical issues through the entirety of having the app.
(Messages, matches, etc) 
I had befriended one on Instagram who told me my messages was not going through to them on Bumble Business.

I decided to upgrade and get the life membership. (To save money long term)
And to be able to connect with more people.

They advertise and suggest these features are truly unlimited when it‚Äôs not.

If you are on the free version they cap you on daily activity.

If you use the premium they see doing too much activity as spam. And can block you from the app  at any time without warning.

Due to all the technical issues I was having and people not getting my messages on the app.
I suggested people could reach out to me on Instagram or continue to speak here within the app.
(You can have your Instagram attached to your profile. Which would mean anyone could see your Instagram if they desired to.)
Which is why I ONLY shared a partnered app as an additional means of communication due to Bumbles technical issues.
I would of been more patient, however connections do expire if you do not message them promptly.

In all if I did it all over I would of stuck with the free version and only reach out to 5-10 people daily. And would of asked the other person their desired means of communication and not directly giving my own. 

Hope this review helps.
title: WARNING: Read Before Paying For Upgrade.

I‚Äôve used numerous apps over the years and decided to try Bumble because of the success stories of heard from it but it‚Äôs still the same problem; you match, message first, wait, and match/message expires. review: Used to use Bumble a few years ago and it was a great app both from a tech perspective and also the quantity and quality of people available. You also used to get to use 2 free filters. They took that away. It also used to be a reasonable price if you felt like paying for a few months. They took that away too. Now it‚Äôs $40/month. Seems like Bumble has come down with a severe case of the greeds. This app isn‚Äôt for me anymore so I just deleted it.

Sometimes I‚Äôm in different towns and want to see the availability in that area. But because I swiped right 5 minutes ago I can‚Äôt now. I liked it better when you got so many likes in a day and that was it. I was more conservative with likes then because I knew when I was about out. Now it‚Äôs like you log on, first person is great so you swipe right, then you can‚Äôt swipe right for hours so you‚Äôre done. And no I do not pay for premium, I know that would fix all this and probably the point of it. But I have yet to find success with a dating app and until it‚Äôs proven that I can find quality people I am interested in, I‚Äôm not paying for the same people to pop up over and over in my area.
title: Changed

developerResponse: {'id': 26380816, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2021-11-20T17:16:58Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using bumble on and off for like 5 years now. I understand that bumble is ultimately a business but it takes every cheap tactic in the conversion book to get you to pay. It will tell you that you have x amount of people that like you but will show them to you very sparsely(2-3 every day) till you get frustrated and force yourself to premium. After you hit the end of the line for the day, it won‚Äôt tell you when you can come back to see new people, forcing you to keep revisiting the app in hopes it is back, adding to the frustration. The notifications are such clickbait‚Äôs that I had to switch them off completely. Do yourself a favor and only keep the notifications on when someone messages you. And its price point is way too high as compared to its competitors. Opening bumble leaves me more frustrated than hopeful.
title: Squeezes you in every way to get premium or pay

review:
Mostly beneficial for hetersexual people. Extremely limiting for GSRM people.

An update: I sent the following to Bumble, because I can no longer tolerate this app.
Make BumbleBFF GSRM friendly. 

I‚Äôm tired of one gender and lack of diversity. You allow more genders but put those genders into two boxes, creating a genuinely undesired atmosphere. I deleted this app and will not redownload it until I see some significant steps towards inclusivity on BumbleBFF. 

And, the subscription is insane. I hear Apple is hammering down on scams based on the criteria of being ridiculously expensive for what an app offers. This lowkey sounds just like Bumble. 

I did a survey this year and was asked to participate in a research/informational study. I specifically stated that I only used BumbleBFF in the survey and in the emails going back and forth inquiring about the study I was asked to participate in by Bumble based on my survey. Yet, once the pre-interview occurred, all the questions were for BumbleDating. Not cool. So much of my time and energy was wasted because no one paid attention to my survey details. Isn't the whole point of doing surveys is to look at the details???? - coming for a survey analyst. 

Many massive changes need to be made on BumbleBFF before I consider using it and re-downloading it. 

P.S. This app is only inclusive for heterosexual people who desire same-sex relations. I am not interested in that ideology. 

Mx. Rhia Linders
title: Not for GSRM people

Now I‚Äôve reached out to customer service and followed up twice and have received no response. There is no phone number to call and your department is either ignoring me or is empty. There was nothing controversial on my profile and I was getting plenty of engagement. Fix your customer service and fix your draconian reporting and banning policy.

My only other issue is when it tells me that I have all these people on my beeline, I get notifications left and right that people want to meet me and I should hop back on and see who liked me, and then it never shows me who liked me, in all the people that it shows... It doesn‚Äôt matter if you have it set for 10 miles 50 miles or the whole country. It‚Äôs rather annoying quite honestly.

title: Hmm.

developerResponse: {'id': 38384699, 'body': "Thanks for your positive feedback. We're rooting for you! üêù", 'modified': '2023-08-18T14:25:45Z'}
review: Have found that this app has the best quality women in every regard relative to competing apps. They are friendly, funny, driven, and very good looking. There is an element of pressure that is not there with the 24 hour rule that encourages more messaging and connections. As a guy, if a girl messages me I know there is a strong likelihood she will respond and engage in a conversation. The Speed Date feature is also really cool because everyone is there with the intention of finding a connection and chatting, it puts you in front of 8-10 quality matches for a few minutes and allows you to connect with them beyond the window if both swipe right. Would recommend Bumble over Tinder or Hinge 10 times out of 10!
title: Best Dating App

If you have any other suggestions feel free to contact our team at bumble.com/help/#contact-us.", 'modified': '2021-04-13T16:54:44Z'}
review: I liked bumble! Very easy to work with, good layout. The only problems I have with it is how if you miss an opportunity to message a match then you are forced to pay to match again with them which I find is totally unfair. I understand on a business point of view, but still I find it problematic. The other problem I have is the location. Other dating apps, don‚Äôt show you‚Äôre location at all, or some even allow you to change your location. I say this is a problem because of safety, online dating can be tricky and sometimes scary especially as a female. Just the thought of matching or attracting a weirdo who then knows what town I live in is a very frightening situation. That‚Äôs mainly the reason I deleted bumble, if bumble would just allow you to put a town closest to you without having to actually reveal what town you really live in would be best!
title: Good but has its problems.

developerResponse: {'id': 21948114, 'body': "We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2021-03-30T11:19:17Z'}
review: For an app that tried to differentiate itself by allowing women more agency within online dating, I find there are few safeguards to verify the identity of the users who are matching with you and allow a comfortable experience once engagement transitions off of Bumble. Many profiles are vague and incomplete, with the app offering no minimum profile inputs, and verification is only optional. I matched with someone who pretended to have one persona within the app, then immediately harassed and insulted me using racial slurs while attempting to coerce me into a situation I was uncomfortable with. This experience has opened my eyes to how dangerous online dating can be and I feel very unsafe now that these types of platforms offer us little to no guarantees of who we are connecting with, yet exist to promote the maximum amount of visibility, matches and engagement. I‚Äôm looking forward to see how this platform can offer more security and transparency, as well as change to appropriately reflect the real life persona of people who are using this app.
title: No safeguards for users

review: Honestly I loved bumble when it 1st came out. I got a good amount of matches for the period of time I was using it. But things slowly went from bad to worse with the app. The interaction were bad, I ran into many bot accounts trying to convince me to buy their nudes/Onlyfans, to me getting harassed by my Ex and getting reported by her and being banned. I‚Äôve tired reading to out customer service multiple time over the years and I have had no luck in getting a response from anyone from bumble customer support, but what they did do is Flag my number and iOS so I can be banned on other dating apps as well. Now I will admit I‚Äôve genuinely tried to contact Bumble multiple time and they refuse to undo my ban or at least answer my questions on why I was banned. All in all tho bumble is a okay app but just be careful of the people who you match with cause if you don‚Äôt you‚Äôll end up like me and permanently banned off every app.
title: My honest review of bumble and my experience

review: I am one of the unbelievable lucky people who chose this app on a whim, and I met someone special who turned out to be the love of my life. title: Glass Half Empty or Half Full

developerResponse: {'id': 30052427, 'body': "Hi Zazapi. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. While this is the way our app works now, if we can help your experience further right now, please send us a message at bumble.com/contact. üíõ", 'modified': '2022-05-30T13:23:57Z'}
review:
Bumble is definitely erring on the side of misandry (the opposite of misogyny). Women have to begin the conversations, but I‚Äôm not sure how many women realize that. The number of times women will swipe right on you and never message you is staggeringly high. They would never let a man undo his right swipe because ‚Äúwe‚Äôve already told them you like and that would be rude!‚Äù But women can right swipe, see the match and immediately delete the match. 

You know how women on most sites will say ‚Äúdon‚Äôt start the conversation with just a ‚Äúhey‚Äù ‚Äúhi‚Äù ‚Äúsup‚Äù‚Äù? Well that‚Äôs exactly what women do on here. And the profiles that say ‚ÄúI‚Äôm looking for someone who can actually hold a conversation‚Äù are the worst at it. Like the actual worst. It would be laughable if it weren‚Äôt so frustrating. 

Also, they don‚Äôt have a specific trans section. So don‚Äôt be surprised if you swipe right on someone only to find out they are trans. It‚Äôs fine to be trans, but the section is looking for women not looking for trans women. Maybe the devs could make a separate area for that, but no, you just have to hope they are being honest before you ask them out. And watch out for the girls just advertising for their only fans. 

I get what devs want to accomplish by setting it up differently, but they have basically failed and made it a place where women can swipe and flake out with zero consideration for others.
title: Not the worst thing ever

review: The application itself functions well for the most part. The people are good and creating matches of mutual attraction works as well if not better than other apps. That being said, there are bugs, one of which has logged me out and locked me from the account and there is absolutely no way to contact/involve support staff. The issue has occurred on multiple occasions, after the first I had to just make a completely new account. I went through every avenue to try to contact support but doing so is a huge hassle and have never received any contact back from their staff. My overarching advice is just not even to download this app. It‚Äôs not even close to worth the headache it puts you through. If you do download it DO NOT spend money becoming a member or adding the in-app purchase features. You will lose what you paid for when you‚Äôre inevitably locked out for no reason and there‚Äôs no way to get a hold of anyone.

title: Bumble app

developerResponse: {'id': 31153266, 'body': "Thanks so much for reaching out and sharing your suggestions with us. Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members, and we'll be sure to share your thoughts with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-07-28T23:22:19Z'}
review:
Overall, the app is easy, intuitive, designed well, and I love the idea of women making the first move. However, I have some suggestions.

1) PLEASE add options for ethical non-monogamy. OkCupid has this in spades and I see where some people have wasted their time on a match that doesn‚Äôt actually match with them. It‚Äôs simply because the question was never asked and it takes up real estate in the limited profile space.

2) The profile is very limiting. There‚Äôs something to be said for ‚Äúless is more‚Äù, but when all you get is three pictures and two sentences, it‚Äôs just not much to go off of. We only get to list five interests? I have DOZENS. I understand not wanting things to get too cluttered, but please give me more room to work with.

3) I would love an option to rate profiles, especially when I‚Äôm swiping left. I don‚Äôt need to be able to send more than one message. But sometimes I wanna say, ‚ÄúHey, I‚Äôm swiping left because I don‚Äôt meet your boundaries, but thank you for being so honest and clear about those boundaries. I wish you luck.‚Äù Or sometimes, ‚ÄúHey, I like you, but I‚Äôm swiping left because your profile is super unclear and I couldn‚Äôt tell anything about your interests or your boundaries. Just a tip.‚Äù
title: Good app, needs improvements

developerResponse: {'id': 28986944, 'body': 'Thanks for your kind words! Your feedback is so valuable to our team and we love knowing that you‚Äôre enjoying your experience. We‚Äôre so lucky to have you as a part of The Hive. üíõ', 'modified': '2022-04-05T21:22:06Z'}
review: In an electronic age as much as I despise technology I can respect the value of finding your person whom we may not bump into at the grocery store.  Bumble does this best they are leaders in this arena and offer everything your own device would such as talking, texting and video chat with the added security of protecting ones private phone & address until you feel comfortable enough to give it.  I also appreciate the feature of hiding people you simply do not want to pop up again in swipes as well as the opportunity to report unacceptable behavior! Bumble listens! There is so much to appreciate about Bumble. To me they have it covered in the details that really matter.  Safety, security responsible and respectful behaviour.
title: Bumble is the leader!

developerResponse: {'id': 34147450, 'body': "Hi Frequensea. We're sorry you didn't enjoy your experience on Bumble. Our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@BumbleSupport) and we'd be happy to help.", 'modified': '2023-01-07T21:41:01Z'}
review:
Over the past week I have gotten and reported NUMEROUS amounts of MEN when my filters CLEARLY state I am searching for females!

What the app does when you don‚Äôt pay for the service is only allow you to see a certain number of users each day/week to encourage you to pay for the service to find matches. 

Since I am using it as a free service I don‚Äôt go swipe crazy because I know that the females have to message first and I can‚Äôt keep 20 conversations going so it‚Äôs actually kind of nice to only scroll on it for a few people a day to see if there is mutual connection. 

However what I‚Äôm NOT ok with is when I put my preference as MALE SEARCHING FEMALE. I get multiple men in my feed and it wastes my swipes for the day (usually 3-5).

I‚Äôm legitimately using the app to search for someone and not some booty call and I have reported 5 accounts this week alone. I told them in my last report that I would delete my account and leave a negative review if another MAN shows up in my list.

BYE! There‚Äôs fake accounts everywhere that ‚Äúlike‚Äù you and you NEVER find them because they want you to pay for the service. 

I‚Äôm in Okinawa Japan where it‚Äôs literally a 65 mile Long Island yet i run out of searches each day using make KM radius. 

This app is a scam and it‚Äôs unfortunate that they do this to people who are genuinely looking for a future partner.
title: No longer a straight male app!

review: I hate the idea of a business manipulating peoples emotions for profit but, here we are. Basically if you sign up for bumble (or many other dating apps I presume) you will be quickly hit with more likes than you would even imagine. After you pay for membership, you will find out many if not all are either fake or don‚Äôt actually communicate. After you pay you will also find, where you were overwhelmed with likes, and the thought that maybe just maybe you could make one meaningful connection, we‚Äôll say good bye to the likes, they stop. If I had more time I would LOVE to start a campaign to rise against this manipulation, these apps/companies don‚Äôt care 1% about your happiness or making real relationships, just another money grab. Please, I hope to help at-least one person save their money, it may be hard but it seems internet dating has deteriorated. Go into the world and meet people the old fashion way, best of luck!
title: Scam

developerResponse: {'id': 25998778, 'body': "Hi there. Thank you so much for raising this to us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we'll definitely pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2021-11-01T03:51:44Z'}
review: Dating apps; Yes it‚Äôs easy to cast a wide net for some but for others It helps soothe the initial sense of inadequacy for many people. (Maybe we can include a filter to help identify narcissists and sociopaths). So yes, many people that struggle with mental illness prefer dating apps most of the time. I understand why others would want a mental health filter but I personally am not going to sign a HIPPA release just because someone thinks they have the right to know privileged information.  Now put me on a compare chart like I‚Äôm a credit card. If I had the best apr, cash back bonuses and miles‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ I wouldn‚Äôt be on a dating app. Don't be lazy. Just tell people that you aren‚Äôt prepared to support someone that isn‚Äôt at least high functioning in their mental health struggle. That is what you are saying, you just don‚Äôt want people to think poorly of you for saying so.
title: re: mental health filter.

review: I‚Äôll start by mentioning I‚Äôm a male. I signed up and began using incognito mode. A week into it and swiping right on at least 100 people in that time there‚Äôs still not a single match. Now I‚Äôm not the worst looking guy, I just don‚Äôt feel like I wouldn‚Äôt get a single match from one of 100 + people on the app especially when within a couple of days of using tinder I was in double digits of ‚Äòlikes‚Äô. I brought it to the attention of the developers and they told me what I was doing wrong without asking any questions. Apparently I needed to make sure I had all six picture slots filled - already had done that. Then I needed to write something in my profile - done that already. And that I am swiping left too much. Then they said that they had dealt with my query. Interesting that they will happily take my money and tell me what I‚Äôve done wrong without seeking more info in my query. So far, it‚Äôs been a complete waste of the subscription paid.
title: Incognito mode flaw?

review: Absolutely abhorrent customer service. The app had some glitch where it wouldn‚Äôt let me cancel the daily subscription. Emailed ‚Äúcustomer service ‚Äú repeatedly until some mouthy rep finally responded and said they‚Äôd sent multiple responses and suggested I check my spam folder. Um‚Ä¶ no. It might be your first day on the internet but it‚Äôs not mine. That experience paired with an earlier billing issue means I won‚Äôt return to this app. The app itself is okay. As others have noted, a 24 hour match window is too short but the overall idea of women messaging first, is good. Also, one of the weirdest things about this platform is that the pricing is different depending on whether you‚Äôre on the app or on desktop, which makes zero sense to me. Also, a 300 character limit for a profile to try and describe yourself, is absurd. Overall, with my experience with them ending up with disputing their charges through my bank, I cannot recommend this app.
title: Beware their billing

developerResponse: {'id': 22302924, 'body': 'Hi there, our team would love the opportunity to improve your experience in the Hive! Please message our Support Team on Twitter or Facebook (@bumblesupport).', 'modified': '2021-04-18T09:10:50Z'}
review: This is both a pro and a con. It takes almost no effort to set up but there just is not enough stuff to add to your profile to really give someone an idea of it would be a good match. For one, they could really use a sexuality filter. Secondly, it would help if it forced you to actually fill out your profile and verify yourself at the start instead of randomly after you are allowed to start swiping. I find a ton of people who have just joined the app and only have their one selfie shown on their profile and that‚Äôs it, and the verification is just an extra safety measure. Third, I have noticed the app sends me message notifications way after I actually receive a notification and end up missing out when the person messaging is actually on the app. Simply, its too simple, which makes it both great and terrible at the same time.
title: Its very simple

The notifications don‚Äôt come through half the time and unless I open the app I wouldn‚Äôt know if I had a message or not. There should be an option not to see someone who is on travel mode unless that is wanted bc why would someone want that unless they are aware. review: I‚Äôm a male and let me direct you guys to tinder. This is why. Dating is dangerous for women no matter what app you use or who makes the first move. Men make the first move in person so I‚Äôm not understanding the benefit here for women. They pick who they want like pieces of meat? But you have women who want to be approached so this puts women in a weird position especially if they like the traditional male approach. Now for men since we have to sit and wait for a response, we should see who likes us males for free so we can swipe or not swipe and women can make their first move and keep the flow going. But that‚Äôs not going happen so for an easier flow of online dating tinder would be more ideal. Yes I know people will say it‚Äôs for sex but that‚Äôs every app. If you like to play the gen z game of who messages first, you‚Äôre in the right place. Tinder is a quick swipe and y‚Äôall start talking immediately. No issues with that. No sitting around waiting. Just two people who swiped on each other and work from there.

developerResponse: {'id': 38195643, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2023-08-09T15:53:10Z'}
review: I like the concept of dating apps, but in execution they make people feel like numbers and stats on a screen rather than actual people. Meeting people in person is so much better because we aren‚Äôt held to the expectation that we‚Äôre always looking for the perfect partner. When meeting people in real life, we get to actually know people and accept them for their flaws, rather than filtering them out without getting to know eachother. There‚Äôs just no meaning to online dating for me anymore. I want something real. I don‚Äôt want someone who wants me because I just so happened to have their ideal height, skin color and political stances, I just want things to form naturally. I go on here and I don‚Äôt even know if the person I‚Äôll meet will actually like me for me, and I come to accept that I will never know. I just don‚Äôt think dating apps are for me anymore and I think our culture would feel less lonely without them.
title: Can dating apps just die out already?

developerResponse: {'id': 30109295, 'body': 'Thanks for updating your review.\nWe always appreciate feedback from our users.', 'modified': '2022-06-02T01:47:35Z'}
review:
...may as well put the final nail in bumbles coffin then. I had mostly enjoyed dating on Bumble over the past few years. However, it was already the least used of the major dating apps meaning you got higher quality but fewer dates than hinge or tinder. But now, when you can only like a few people every 24 hours unless you pay, people are going to get even fewer dates if any at all, ...so, they are going to shed users like mad ...making it far less interesting to pay...leading to a downward cycle out of the market. Not smart. Bummer as it was a good concept.

Update:  Bumbles response below is a lie - you get about 10-20 swipes for free which makes Bumble useless in any town above 2000 people; i.e. you have to pay.  This lie/corporate buttsaving response makes me wonder what happened since the days of this company's awesome response to tinder

review: I just deleted the app after spending the last 10 days swiping through profiles of people who live out of state. I paid the premium price, hoping that I could get better filters and be more specific about who I am looking for. But there is no option to make sure that you‚Äôre only being shown people who live near you. There is no option to specify ENM and of course no option to filter it out. I can filter by zodiac sign, seriously? But I can‚Äôt filter on marital status. The best bees even kept showing me people who don‚Äôt live anywhere near me, have incomplete profiles and don‚Äôt match my filters. I also can‚Äôt control how broadly my profile is distributed, so I kept looking in my beeline and finding people who lived very far away that had liked me. I find that rather creepy.
title: What does $60 actually buy?

review: Of the dating apps I‚Äôve used, bumble has been the best in terms of structure and format, but there are some aspects of it that really show their hand as far as their business model goes. If I could make two changes, I‚Äôd move the ability to see who likes you to the free side of the app and I‚Äôd add something like an analytics feature that shows how often people view your profile. That‚Äôs not exactly violating anyone‚Äôs privacy (assuming it‚Äôs just a view counter). If I‚Äôm not getting as many likes, I‚Äôd like to know if it‚Äôs because I‚Äôm not being seen by potential partners or if I need to pivot and adjust my profile. If it needs to be a premium feature, that‚Äôs fine- but more information is always better.

review: For a company that runs on empowerment of women they show it in an idiotic way. Should you need further assistance, please message us at bumble.com/contact and we'll be happy to help.", 'modified': '2022-04-28T00:10:15Z'}
review:
The good: the interface is user-friendly and looks nice. Prompts are fine, not great.

The bad: my profile identifies me as a woman interested in women; but probably at least 1 in 10 profiles is a heterosexual couple **looking for a third!** which is really fetishy and uncomfortable. First of all, it seems bizarre that bumble isn‚Äôt regulating or tracking whether profiles belong to individuals or couples, and second, if they‚Äôre allowing couples to have profiles, then they should at least also give users the option to filter them out and only see individuals if they so choose.

The whole experience just feels icky to me because I‚Äôm looking for someone to date monogamously, and I don‚Äôt like thinking that these straight men are just reviewing my profile wondering if I‚Äôll be the one to help him fulfill his gross fantasy of a threesome with a lesbian who **maybe he can turn!**
title: Uncomfortable for queer women

developerResponse: {'id': 28331171, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-03-02T10:45:40Z'}
review:
It greatly confuses me that bumble does not have a place to filter by or indicate my sexuality. Only being able to choose between men and women is crazy, considering the growing number of people coming out of the closet who are neither men nor women. It‚Äôs really frustrating that I can‚Äôt filter by sexuality, I have to choose between seeing men, women, or everybody. I don‚Äôt want to see men I want to see everyone else who isn‚Äôt straight. Insane to have a dating app that doesn‚Äôt let you put your sexuality in the year 2022 like what.

Also the app really needs to include options for people to indicate that they are ethically non-monogamous or a couple looking for a third because that is half of the people I see on the app when my preferences are set to be interested in women. Also, some men are listed as women, so there are straight men that pop up on my feed. Again, this is why there should be a sexuality feature.
title: It‚Äôs 2022 and still no sexuality feature??

Bumble used to be a decent app to get on if your a guy. But now it‚Äôs become super predatory on the consumer. They also had a really cool feature that tinder don‚Äôt even have which allowed you one back track which came in super handy if you mindlessly swipe and realize you wanted to learn more about someone. Like all good things they took that feature away and locked it behind a paywall. 
The apps intentions are in the right place but they have made it so disadvantageous for guys that it‚Äôs legit not worth. Simple economics, when a substitute good is both cheaper and a better quality then the demand for your good is going to decrease.  How this app remains open is a grim reality of how much this industry preys on lonely people, specifically lonely men on this app.

review: The app seems harmless and trendy, but it‚Äôs a trap. They filter out your matches. Many of the options they present in the beginning are fake profiles to help the algorithm figure out your ‚Äútype‚Äù then the mix it up and send you completely opposite matches and throw a good one in there once in a while to keep you interested. Also not the safest app since they show your profile to even unmatched users. It‚Äôs like tagged and tinder repackaged, definitely not worth the premium price and they don‚Äôt offer refunds. Lots of fake profiles and unscreened matches. They don‚Äôt verify so you could end up dating someone who is married. We would never arbitrarily block someone from our platform. If you would like our team to review your case, message @BumbleSupport on Twitter or Facebook.', 'modified': '2023-08-18T08:58:49Z'}
review:
This app seemed refreshing at first, but I had barely begun to use it, traveling between continents as I did so, when my profile was suddenly blocked without explanation by the developer. 

Since I had only texted one anodyne response to one match among very few while briefly in Japan (whereas Hinge and other app connections have been much more frequent and high quality), I was perplexed and sent a message to the helpline.

Many days later, my spam folder received a response asking me to verify my email, which was odd. When I tried to use the link, it had expired, so I wrote another email to the developers, out of curiosity more than anything else.

They eventually replied that they investigated my case and deemed the elimination justified because I was conducting ‚Äúcommercial activity‚Äù. I can‚Äôt think of any of my answers to their prompts or anything in that one message I sent that would qualify ‚Äúas commercial activity‚Äù. The lack of definition would be funny if it weren‚Äôt so unilateral and maddeningly unspecific. And yes, I had read their guidelines before!

I wonder if an algorithm or lazy human monitor did this: it doesn‚Äôt matter. There are much better apps with defter AI and less erroneously conceived self-righteousness out there, and I‚Äôm meeting really interesting people all the same.

Bon chance, Bumble.
title: Profile Blocked for ‚ÄúCommercial Activity‚Äù‚Ä¶?

review:

I was an occasional user of this app,  who would go on dates and if I find a person I like then I would delete the app. After my last relationship I thought I‚Äôll give it a try again and I re-download the app and entered my info into the log in and it did not  work. I was very confused for I do not have any behavior that is worthy of a ban so severe. I emailed the company not 1 but 4 times. They never got back to me why I was banned. 
To conclude if your looking for a dating service that treats its loyal customers wrong and disrespectful, this is the app you use.

review:
I understand the objection of any company is to make money. And I used to have some decent luck and enjoyed this app, I‚Äôve even purchased premium a time or two when it was more reasonably priced.

I‚Äôve been swiping for over a week now to try and match with the 2 women in my ‚ÄúBeeline‚Äù and will run out of my daily like limit before ever seeing their unblured photo show up. 

You used to have to swipe a bit to find your matches but It never used to be this bad. I‚Äôve done everything from expanding my filters, clearing cache, re-installing the app and reaching out to customer service. Was basically told, that‚Äôs just the way it is. Just makes me not want to use the app anymore to meet people. Really hope this gets fixed but I‚Äôm no holding my breath.

review: I think Bumble is the easiest to use out of all the dating apps I‚Äôve tried. People‚Äôs profiles make it easy to see what their interests are and what they‚Äôre looking. review:
It‚Äôd be one thing to pay for the service, but the price is outrageous. It‚Äôs very easy to miss notifications, and ofc people get fed up with missing messages & limited daily swipes, so they go off it - so there are all these phantom profiles lurking around taking up space that no one seems to check. Then once in a blue moon someone logs back on & likes your profile but you don‚Äôt see the message unless you‚Äôre logging in every day - within 24 hours it disappears. You have to live on this app for it to work well, and this reduces the user base, making it ultimately less effective. The price to reconnect after the 24 hours mark is currently exorbitant, and no option to pay for one single missed connection.

That said, I made one friend on here & that was cool.

review: As a woman on this app, I just can‚Äôt shake the unnatural feeling I have being the first to make the ‚Äúmove‚Äù on a man. Would I do this in any other situation in life? No. I pay for my subscription because I want to see who swiped on me. The problem I seem to run into is a plethora of men in my ‚ÄúBeeline‚Äù of whom might just be furiously swiping right - they may not being paying and are simply playing hit or miss. It‚Äôs a real shoot down when I as the woman take my time to compose a thoughtful message to a man who I‚Äôm thinking swiped on me only to be left hanging - they don‚Äôt respond to my message....this is where my feminine energy is depleted and confused. Unless you were/are an aggressive woman in the world of dating and you like to be the risk taker in the realms of dating as a woman; this app may not be for you my lady friends. developerResponse: {'id': 38614486, 'body': 'We‚Äôre thrilled you made such a special connection in the Hive! Please tell us more about your story at https://bumble.com/success-stories/share üíõ', 'modified': '2023-08-30T10:00:32Z'}
review:
After three unsuccessful dates, I matched with my boyfriend. We have been dating for two years now. It was mostly luck because we both increased our searches a little further and he said he was close to deleting it. 

If you‚Äôre not having luck, try some of my suggestions:
1. Don‚Äôt start with hi, hello, how are you, etc. it‚Äôs boring and a conversation killer. We know you‚Äôre trying to be nice but it shows 0 individuality. Show us you read our profile, a joke, literally anything else.
2. For the love of whatever deity you worship, fill out your profile. Show who you are at a glance. Stand out. Play video games? Put it on your profile. Favorite bands? Put which ones. Something. Anything.
3. Leave the pictures of you catching things for your friends. We don‚Äôt care that you caught the biggest one on a trip from 3 years ago.

It‚Äôs okay to go for looks, but at the end of the day, make sure you guys have enough in common to sustain more than just that. Relationships are more than skin-deep. Unless you‚Äôre hooking up. In that case, Tinder is probably better.
title: 2 years now

review: I don‚Äôt know what it is, the algorithms, the maximum mile radius, but bumble was the medium for God to put the woman I adore into my life. review:
This platform has violated my name. I was kicked off the app when I would try to access it on my phone, but didn't pay it much mind since I was not having much success with the matches anyways. I cancelled my payed service and wanted to get on to my profile to delete it, I tried my laptop since my phone app was not successful, to find that the account that I was not able to access had been blocked because of "several reports" of some sort of misconduct. 

This was not me since I was not even able to access the service I paid for. I would like to know what this alleged misconduct was and why no one ever reached out to me? My account was obviously hacked which causes great concern and anger for me when these are my pictures and name attached to whatever was done. 

I have been off and on of this app for a few years and would recommend to friends. Never again. This has been a terrible experience, and that is now my messaging. I would also like insurance that my profile has been completely deleted since I have been "banned" and cannot do it on my own. 
 
This is what I tried to go to the ‚Äúhelp center‚Äù with, but couldn‚Äôt even get through there. Hopefully someone is able to reach out in this way. I demand that my profile is deleted.

monetizing the app, they‚Äôre killing it!  I just deleted my info, then my profile, then the app from my phone. Otherwise, they hold onto it! By on my crude, rudimentary, statistics based research, 54% of alleged users are not real. They are there to keep you hoping. 

Men; how often have you struck up a conversation with the ‚Äúone‚Äù, and thought it was going well, and as soon as you share your number, email, Skype address, etc., they ghost you?  Serious question.  I deleted it all at three times. Statistics do not lie!  Three times is a pattern, period.  Gents, save your money for seeking, the ladies are real ladies, and the frauds are quickly gone, cuz the women who want to be there out them. But, once it expired, incredibly I started getting at least 2 ‚Äúlikes‚Äù a day which I could only see if I purchased another premium membership. review: This app is fine overall and have good chat functions. I understand they took away the ethnicity filter to boost chances of people who typically get fewer matches, such as Asian men, but I WANT TO see more Asian men and almost never get pushed any. How am I supposed to train the algorithm to know my preferences if they don‚Äôt include enough profiles of each ethnicity in the first place? title: How far bumble has fallen

developerResponse: {'id': 28986241, 'body': "Thanks for sharing this feedback with us. Bumble is always looking for new ways to improve the experience of our members. We really appreciate you taking the time to leave us your feedback about this, and we'll be sure to share it with our Product Team.", 'modified': '2022-04-05T20:40:57Z'}
review:
The developer had made his own Bumble obsolete on older iPhones, but now has apparently fixed that problem so I‚Äôm back to testing if it‚Äôs really usable. 

Two major problems I see are 

1) the use of meaningless hieroglyphic icons that seem to randomly switch around on every page makes navigation very tedious and difficult; WHEN will developers learn to use text menus that we can just look at to see what they‚Äôre for, instead of having to experiment by clicking on every one to see if they do something useful or are what we‚Äôre looking for?  A single drop down text menu in the upper left corner where menus belong would be a massive improvement in usability, instead of scattering meaningless hieroglyphs randomly around the screen. 

2) poor contrast of light yellow-orangey text on white backgrounds in Setup areas makes certain operations slow and difficult. Not as bad as the use of meaningless icons, but still unnecessary. Suspect the developer isn‚Äôt using naive testers on a variety of devices like he should, but instead is probably developing on a Mac with a high contrast screen where his light-on-light text is discernible and where the use of meaningless hieroglyphics for navigation has long been standard practice‚Äîand the reason that I and many others loathe Apple products.
title: Improved from before

It‚Äôs honestly a shame because until now i preferred bumble to other dating apps but there really isn‚Äôt much point if i can only like five people a day, i mean if i just go to Walmart I end up seeing like 50 people so my chances of finding someone are 10 times higher if I try to pick up girl in Walmart. review: I like the app, it has a wide variety of women of different professions. My only gripe is that it limits you to whom you swipe right to in 24 hours and you have to wait for the next day to be able to swipe again. To be able to swipe unlimitedly, you need to pay 8 dollars per week, which is quite high of a price. As a result of the limit on swipes, it may take longer to swipe right on someone who may like you and has already swiped right. You can‚Äôt see the ones who‚Äôve swiped right on you, until you connect with them. Despite these flaws, I believe most women are interested in dating but some are more interested on adding Instagram followers or will message you and not respond. Regardless, I am hopeful I may meet my long term match and I do recommend it.

title: Feels Judgemental

developerResponse: {'id': 22333986, 'body': "Hi there, we're sorry to hear you haven't had the best experience on Bumble. Please message us at support@team.bumble.com so we can look in to this for you :)", 'modified': '2021-04-19T18:19:30Z'}
review:
You don‚Äôt get much for what you pay for. I have better luck meeting people in pretty much every other dating app, or in person. I‚Äôve used thousands of apps on iOS since it‚Äôs inception and I can honestly say this is the worst value of any app I‚Äôve used from the App Store. I‚Äôm not just saying this because I can‚Äôt ‚Äòget a date‚Äô, I‚Äôm happily talking to multiple people outside of this app. It‚Äôs just a terrible value all around in my opinion.

You will constantly see matches in your ‚ÄòBee line‚Äô, which is supposed to show you people who have liked you before you have swiped left on them. The problem is people just swipe left on everyone and by the time you look at the ‚Äòbee line‚Äô they have already deleted you from their queue. This was a feature that convinced me to try premium and it‚Äôs completely useless as such.

The app is constantly pushing you to use its premium features,  and things like ‚Äòsuper swipes‚Äô are too easy to accidentally engage with no way of reversing it. I found myself using up premium things like ‚Äòboost‚Äô and ‚Äòsuper swipes‚Äô by accident and no way to restore or undo it. Support from the company is severely lacking considering the premium cost is a whopping $32 a month.

The app renewed yesterday and even though it charged me another $32, I‚Äôll be removing it. It‚Äôs just not good for me. Perhaps you‚Äôll have better luck with it.
title: Feel ripped off

developerResponse: {'id': 39092870, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2023-09-23T12:13:17Z'}
review:
I‚Äôll make this quick with a few bullet points: 

 -There are not enough info requirements. There are too many profiles that are just pictures and nothing else. 

 -It is impossible to see who likes you without paying. 

 -It is incredibly easy to swipe left accidentally. The fact that you have to pay to backtrack tells me that this UX failure is a cash grab. 

 -Algorithm seems more randomized and less tailored to your preferences/key words, making the app a bigger waste of time. 

-Comments/compliments cannot consistently be left on profiles without paying.

 Hinge suffers from none of these cons, and yet Bumble gives no good reason for you to tolerate the tradeoff of using Bumble instead of Hinge. Don‚Äôt waste your time with this app. If this review gets a canned/automated response from Bumble that merely provides some support link and doesn‚Äôt DIRECTLY address and discuss each of the above points, as well as explain why I should choose them over Hinge, it‚Äôll be overwhelmingly clear to you, dear reader, that Bumble would rather stick to a script than actually process and understand what was said here. If you see a canned response, ask yourself if this is really a company you‚Äôre prepared to give money to. You deserve better.

You can only message people who have matched with you, while other apps let you message anyone who catches your eye. I understand they need to make money but this app is insane for what it charges. It‚Äôs $20/week, $77/3month, $230/lifetime membership for premium which allows unlimited likes, unlimited backtrack (go back to someone you left swiped on), unlimited rematch (match with someone you unmatched), beeline (see who likes you), and a couple fancy filters and other features that are offered cheaper on other apps.

review:
I like a lot of the features on this app. Being able to answer questions, more details about yourself, and the filters for your search. 
The 24 hour time table makes it hard to keep up since I have a busy lifestyle it‚Äôd be better for at least 48 hours so if I work long hours, I‚Äôm still able to reply or match. 
The biggest issue I‚Äôve had is the mistaken swipes. I will just be scrolling down their profile and it will go right or left on me. It‚Äôs just too easy to make a mistake and miss someone I wanted to match, or match with someone I didn‚Äôt. 
The super swipe button is also in a bad spot, makes it way too easy to mistakenly hit. I super swiped my ex on accident and had to completely delete my account and start over.

review: I‚Äôve came to the conclusion that like many other dating apps, Bumble is pretty much a rip off. After signing up, I received several likes in just a few hours. So I decided to upgrade for a week. I ended up matching with 12 to 15 of these likes. Not a single message and not another like came in before the week long upgrade ended. As soon as my subscription ran out, I received several more likes within just a couple of days. So, I subscribed for another week. I matched with even more of these likes and not a single reply and no more incoming likes. So I could guess what was happening. As soon as my second subscription ended, the likes started pouring in. Just to prove my hunch, I subscribed for a third week and as you can probably guess, not a single reply from any of the several matches. It‚Äôs just a hoax.

review: I paid 30$ (which is waaay too much money for their premium service. Not worth it at all) for a week of the premium service. I was hoping to see someone who super liked me and I accidentally swiped left on. This person never showed back up again. But one of the worst things about paying for premium was the fact that during that week of the ‚Äúpremium‚Äù service, I almost never got any likes. But once the week of premium was over and it was back to the normal bumble, I started getting notifications of likes immediately. Just a coincidence that as soon as I stop paying for premium likes show up? I think not. I think what bumble does is withhold would be matched with you when you‚Äôre on premium and then release them once you‚Äôve stopped paying to try to reel you back in. It‚Äôs a real dirty tactic and is why hinge and tinder are better.
title: It‚Äôs trash now and they are scammers

Matches within Tinder within 72 hours: 105, messages back and forth with 33, move to text with 11, dates arranged with 6.

developerResponse: {'id': 39384517, 'body': "We appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our users' experience on the app so we will make sure to pass your input along to our Product Team.", 'modified': '2023-10-08T08:51:58Z'}
review:
It seems like every dating app is pay to play nowadays and that‚Äôs fine - but Bumble has become just another micro transaction money grab scheme; constantly bombarding me to purchase ‚ÄúSpotlights‚Äù and ‚Äúcompliments‚Äù, pushing the narrative that my projected success on the app hinges on spending more money for greater visibility. 

A $30 monthly subscription obtains only the most basic features like unlimited swipes, 5 superswipes (which supposedly gain a greater level of attention from potential matches) and 1 spotlight per week. If you want any greater visibility it‚Äôs $60 or more per month which is absurd for a mobile dating app. 

Speed dating almost never works, and after ‚Äúsearching for matches‚Äù and ‚Äúexpanding search distance‚Äù comes back with a prompt to buy spotlights at $2 a pop, which actually bare zero relevance on the speed dating function - yet another sign of a money grab scheme preying on a man‚Äôs loneliness. 

Overall I have not had much success with this app, and while I readily accept my part in that, I have to say a lot of it comes down to an app which seems far more focused on gatekeeping and maximizing profits over quality of user experience, especially for male users. 0/10 would not recommend this experience to anyone I know. I‚Äôm better off at a bar.
title: Banking On Loneliness
